It's freaking WONDERFUL. You just don't get a grasp of how fast this device is when you are looking at it in a retail store.  I did have a one or two times when Silk wouldn't load at work, but it quickly resolved itself. No different from network issues on a computer, so it didn't phase me whatsoever.  I would definitely suggest that if you are someone buying this for school, to go to the pull down menu at the top of the kindle screen, click on the more button and then onto the device link. Add this devices personal email address to your email accounts, so that you can directly email the device documents from Microsoft Word. It might work with the whole Microsoft Suite, but so far I've only tried Word.  This way it shows up quick and easy in your documents, and its' SO easy to use.  Before I figured out how to use the documents, I kept having to go to the drafts folder in my yahoo email to look up the text I wanted to read.  I'm a full time college student, as well as working full time, and I needed a device that was powerful, easy to use, and that had some great browsing, organization, and research capabilities. With my Kindle Fire HD, I can read critical analyses, Wikipedia the author of the book I'm reading, add homework to my calender, and watch lectures online, all without taxing the device.  I would definitely suggest getting a Bluetooth keyboard, as the typing, while intuitive, doesn't really lend itself to getting notes down quickly.  I'm enrolled in a winter semester (mini-mester)class and I'm really looking forward to keeping updated on class assignments, reading textbooks, and using Evernote to load notes for use later, all from my Kindle Fire.  And with the 32 gb model, I'm confident that I won't run out of room anytime soon.  I am glad, after seeing how many books I have in my Cloud drive, that I got the 32gb model rather than the cheaper 16gb model.  I've had this for almost a week now, and I'm feeling really confident that I made the right choice.  If you've already invested in the Amazon universe, and you need a tablet for school, or work, or play, I would very highly recommend this device.  I'm not too impressed with Amazon Prime's selection of free movies, and I probably won't purchase the full edition of it unless the library grows rapidly in the next 6 months. But Netflix works pretty well on the Fire, as well as Hulu Plus, so I wouldn't say that Prime's light offering of movies/tv to stream is that much of a hardship.Sorry if this review is too long, but I tried to review this for the things I would want to know, personally.  Everyone else has already exhaustively covered the specs, so I think readers are covered there...All in all, I am a very satisfied Amazon customer.
Reviews.Title: Exactly what the (Me) Ordered for College

Reviews.Author: david
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure how people can put less than 5 stars on this product, especially if you look at the price.The screen: beautifulThe sound: not as loud as I thought it would be, but the quality is very good. When you watch a movie, you feel the sound comes from everywhere: left, right, behind that's a very good experience.The OS: Perfect for Amazon content, perfect for Netflix and the mp4 I downloaded on the device. There are several apps available for free or purchase and there will be loads to come.The internet browser: I don't like it, I'm going to sideload a better one.Magazines: They look great, but I believe the device is too small for a real good experience (you need to zoom).Oh.. I forgot, I don't get annoyed by the ads, I just got a $2 free voucher for renting video on demand. And the recommendations, I like them, I can see other movies that are prime eligible, that I can watch for free. Recommendations are not ads, and they can be disabled in the settings, for free.
Reviews.Title: Wow

Reviews.Author: Sherri Leasum "Sherri Leasum forestwolf"
Reviews.Content: I just got my 8.9" HD 32g, wifi only ... I LOVE IT. I was amazed at the difference in screen quality between it and the 7" HD i also have. I bought the 8.9" to be my bedside streaming device, and i can already say that it was an EXCELLENT choice. The 7" works well for taking to work etc. But the clarity of the screen on the 8.9" HD make it a wonderful bedside companion for watching shows etc without having to bother anyone else around you. I have arthritis in my hands so I bought a Levlo clamp on stand for my bedside which allows me to support it and whatever viewing angle is the most comfortable and also move it back out of the way while using it as my alarm clock, My 8.9" HD beats the heck out of the Ipad mini's screen and i have twice the storage as he does for the same price points.I love Amazon and the Kindle Line of products.. i also have the new Paperwhite which i love as well. My only complaint is that we do not YET have the same resource for apps that Apple and Google have.. but i am trusting that Amazon is working to get us there.DOLBY SPEAKERS ARE FABULOUS and again BEAT THE IPAD MINI'S ALL TO PIECES.
Reviews.Title: 8.9' Fire HD

Reviews.Author: sharon marshall
Reviews.Content: I'm really loving my kindle HD 8.9 just that few inches in screen size makes an amazing difference in watching a movies or video. For me much less tiring on the eyes and HD quality i enjoy. Amazon should have provided a charger I thought that was rather cheap
Reviews.Title: kindle fire HD 8.9 "

Reviews.Author: Ohio Reader "Elderly, bookish person, omnivor...
Reviews.Content: I was delighted with my Kindle Fire 7" which offered a text size that I could read easily. Then Kindle Fire HD 8.9 came out offering, in addition to the features of KF 7", text-to-speech for e-books and improved sound for Audible books. So glad I switched. The text-to-speech engine is very good with few annoying mispronunciations and a convenient speed control. And Audibile books do sound SO much better. Music and video soundtracks are also much improved with the new audio system. KF HD has a helpful, relevant accessibility setting that adds voice to the control buttons so the tablet is much easier to use for the vision impaired, especially since there is no text-size choice for control buttons. I suspect that if the 7" KF HD has the same accessibility features, it would be just as easy to use and a bit less cumbersome. Time now to explore KF HD's non-bookish features, so I just bought an e-manual to point me to the other cool features. More later......
Reviews.Title: Low vision reader liking accessibility features

Reviews.Author: okiedan "Pro Bono Publico"
Reviews.Content: The reviews are in...and they all look good.  Thanks to all the other reviewers for taking the time to help us all out.  I want to post a short review that may outline a few things others have missed or glossed over.A VERY sincere thank you to Amazon!  After years of back and forth between Amazon and various advocacy groups Amazon has surprised THIS user with a wonderful gift.  I did not expect it and frankly had heard that Amazon once again was going to forget about their visually challenged users.  Not  so!After years of waiting for Amazon..... they finally have accessibility options on the Fire.You can have voice over turned on with explore by touch.  FINALLY.  It also offers a voice guide and an orientation lock.For those of us with vision issues this is a BIG deal.  If I did not have the free accessibility programs that come free on every Apple device I would be lost.  I am heavily invested in the Amazon eco system and read often using the kindle for mac application and activate my voice over and listen to my books.  Conversely I am also heavily invested in the Apple ecosystem.  I chose Apple because of the totally free accessibility features.  If I used a PC I would have to buy a program that cost almost $700.00 just to do the same things I now do for free on my iMac.  No I am not saying apple is better....this is about accessibility for all people.  It is about preserving and protecting the rights of the millions of people who are different in some way than the so called normal person.I have both the 4G LTE 64gb and the WiFi only 32gb.As expected their is no real difference between the two.If you need more storage ,I do, and if you want to be able to do basic Internet activity while mobile ,I do, then the larger capacity 4G is a good choice.Setup on the ATT network was fast and easy.Out of the box the initial startup on both was very easy.  Once joined to my network it downloaded the latest OS and rebooted.The WiFi signal is in fact very good...or I should say the WiFi reception is very good.  I can travel from the front of my house to the far reaches of my backyard and still get a fair signal.  In the house the 5.0ghz signal is strong and consistent.The screen is magnificent.  The clarity and smooth operation are a real joy.  Sometimes if I have too many things happening with it..... i.e...... downloading an Audible book.... downloading some music.... and still attempting to use an app or read a book the device will have a little hiccup.  That however is very rare and easily managed by not trying to do everything at one time.My wife uses Medscape at the hospital and it looks great on the 8.9 screen.  It only took 15 minutes to download all of the required content for this app to work.I am amazed at how fast my content downloads over the WiFi.  I was able to add 30 audible books and 300+ books in a matter of a few hours.  The audible books took the longest.  I found that if I left my devices plugged in to ac and turned off the auto sleep function....my content downloaded a lot faster.If you are using the text to speech application you will be pleased to know it sounds great..... over the Dolby speakers.I also have found that if I turn the brightness down to a minimal level.... using Sepia mode with font at largest I can top light my Fire with mighty bright light to simulate a more Pearl Ink display.  I so this due to the extreme eye strain I suffer when looking at a bright light.......  I was amazed to find this works.  It might look a little strange but who cares!I mount my Fire on a Bookholder stand and use high powered glasses to be able to read the larger print on the Fire.  I do wish they made a couple of larger fonts... maybe later???So to sum it up.  Thanks to Amazon.  I truly thought you did not care about us.  I have been reading on blogs for months about how you would not do anything for special needs folks.  Now you have proved them to be wrong.UPDATE:  Using full accessibility options I have found the tablet easy to use.  The voice clearly tells me where I am on the screen. To open a book I move my finger over the menu to find the word book.  I hear it say book..... then I double click and the book opens.  To open the menu I use three finger swipe up to open and down to close.  Two fingers to change page.  Text to speech is at the bottom..and will open if I tap at the bottom of the screen.  I think I will try some bumps to see if they first will stick and second will not effect the display.  I have one good eye at 20/400 so I can use that to find a lot of things...but I want to know more..... could a totally blind person use bumps on a touch screen.  Will give it a try.  Wish I could get my hands on a few of the textbooks amazon is wanting to sell to schools....would like to see if they are accessible.When using Explore by Touch, use the following gestures to navigate:Unlock your KindleWith two fingers, swipe from right to left near the bottom of the screen.Open the Quick Settings menuWith two fingers, swipe down from the top of the screen.Scroll through items in the carousel and content libraries on the Home screenWith two fingers, swipe to the left or rightTurn pages in a bookWith two fingers, swipe to the left or rightDownload or open an itemDouble-tapMake menu selections onscreenDouble-tapThe Explore by touch also works with your music.  It will state where you are and also give you the artist...then the track name etc...IF you are blind or visually challenged like myself...and would like to discuss this NEW change please feel free to email me.  You can find my Amazon email address on my profile.  Just click on okiedan.
Reviews.Title: Amazon finally has accessibility options.  THANKS!!!!!

Reviews.Author: Onegar
Reviews.Content: Bought the 8.9 Fire with the 4G LTE AT&T; service. After no direction at all on how to set up the AT&T; service we finally managed to find out how to make the payment for the service, only to find out it is $50 per month instead of $50 per year as advertised. We decided to go ahead and sign up and after Christmas we would deal with the difference in the cost. Got payment made,after (5) tries. We then tried to use the AT&T;,showing 3 bars of service strength, we would click on a link and all we would get was the little orange circle going around and around and nothing ever came up. Never one time did we get one website to open while hooked up to AT&T.; We got a notice this morning we had used up our monthly allotted data and that they needed another $50.I have canceled the AT&T; service and am returning the Kindle. The Kindle is probably a great tablet, but you need to stay away from the this one that claims it has 4G LTE AT&T;  service or you will waste $250 of your money like I did. I truly expected better from both of these companies.
Reviews.Title: Fire HD with 4G LTE

Reviews.Author: adam3290
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 after a LOT of research into all the different tablet options. This seemed like the best bang for the buck, so I went ahead and purchased this item from Best Buy. I let it charge for a few hours before using it. Here is my unbiased, concise review so that it may help you in choosing a tablet.Display: Looks great. Text is crisp and clear, and video playback from the internet was very fast (almost instant) and looked very crisp. Amazon advertises the nice HD screen, and it definitely does deliver. Impressive.Sound: As advertised, this is the best sound available on a tablet. Music sounded awesome. I also watched a few HD movie previews from flixter that looked and sounded spectacular.Ease of Use: I am very used to android-based items, so it was very easy to jump into. Even for an apple user, I think the transition would be pretty much instant. The people giving this product negative reviews because it doesn't include an instruction booklet really need to get with the times. If you can't figure this thing out in 15-20 minutes, you have no business with a tablet.Build Quality: Device feels very solid and high quality. My issue is the buttons and the placement of the buttons. They are very flat and somewhat difficult to find. There is a volume button, and a button to shut off the screen (which also shuts off the device when held down). There were many times where I wanted to turn something up, but accidentally turned it down or shut the screen off. Kind of annoying.Web Browsing/Typing: Web browsing is fun and very smooth with this device over Wi-Fi. Pages load quickly and video playback is instant without any buffering or image quality issues. I walked around the house playing YouTube videos and got pretty far away from my Wi-Fi router without any changes in video playback. If you are just looking for a device that is small and able to surf the net with ease, you will definitely enjoy this despite a few issues noted below:- No flash. I knew this ahead of time, but you do not get flash on this device in case you didnt know. I found this to be slightly annoying, but not too bad. A lot of flash-based websites will simply direct the tablet to the mobile version which makes a big difference for some websites while remaining mostly the same for others.- Typing is SLOW. It is a major pain to type something long like an amazon review. SWYPE is AWFUL on this device. This is the major, major flaw. There is no auto-capitalizing, and no auto-spacing. I figured I would be able to swype a paragraph rather quickly, but since you have to hit the space button every time you swype a word, it gets to be very annoying and time consuming. What is the point of swype when you have to stop and hit space every time? For a end of 2012 android device, I thought this was a major mistake by Amazon.Apps: By far the biggest issue with this tablet. App selection is awful, as are the quality of some of the most popular apps. Most people know that Amazon runs a modified version of Android and does not have access to the Google Play Store. I knew this when I purchased the item, but figured it wouldn't be THAT different. I was wrong. App selection is extremely small, and most of the apps are dumb things like chess or puzzle games (not very useful). Popular apps are less functional and seem hastily made for the Kindle Fire. Facebook is among the worst apps for this device. The layout isn't user-friendly, and it has less functionality than a typical Android Facebook App. If you are used to Facebook functionality on a computer or Android phone, you will be disappointed with Facebook on the Kindle Fire HD.Most of the functional and popular apps you probably have on you Android phone are not available for the Kindle either.Ultimately, this lack of apps made me decide not to keep the Kindle.Overall:If you just want to use the internet, watch videos with fantastic image quality/sound, and buy things from Amazon then this tablet will be an excellent choice for you at an excellent price. If you enjoy flash-based websites, full Android functionality, access to Google Playstore, or want a computer-like tablet experience then you will surely be disappointed. You can purchase movies, albums, and typical Amazon items very easily with this device. Amazon lets you have unlimited cloud-based storage for all of the media you purchase from them which is a nice feature. The Kindle Fire HD came off to me as a very smart way for Amazon to sell more merchandise rather than being a fully functional tablet.Pros: Display, Sound, Web-Surfing, Media-Consumption capabilitiesCons: No flash, no expandable storage (even though you do have unlimited cloud storage for Amazon purchases), typing is awful, small selection of available apps, some of the most popular apps are non-existent or poorly madeAfter returning this item, I am continuing my research into a new tablet and am beginning to lean toward the Nexus 10 for an extra $100.00
Reviews.Title: Just wasn't impressed

Reviews.Author: Dean H Ravin
Reviews.Content: My  Kindle HD8.9  has  very short battery life, even in sleep mode it rapidly discharges it's battery. The touch screen is both inconsistent and un-responsive, frequently requiring several presses to input a single keystroke.Kindle's  operating system suffers frequent seizures,"SILK" web  browser locks up 2 or 3 times per hour. Overall, I was not satisfied with the Kindle HD 8.9
Reviews.Title: Glitchy, unresponsive, battery killer.

Reviews.Author: L. Williams
Reviews.Content: I have now purchase 7 Kindles, 6 of the 7" version, and 1 8.9" version. I loved them while they worked. The first one last 3 weeks before it would over heat and then not turn on. Amazon replaced it since it was within 30 days of purchasing. The charger only last 2-3 months tops before they stop working. And not one of my Kindles has lasted over a year before they either stop taking a charge, or they over heat and won't turn on.My other issue with the previous model was my children were able to purchase movies and make purchases even with the password protection on it. Amazon says it isn't possible, but some how my 3 year old was able to purchase a couple hundred dollars in movies and merchandise while I was in the hospital giving birth to his brother. Amazon refused to credit back the money for the movies my son purchased, and if I returned the merchandise I had to pay the shipping for the return. I also ordered a season pass for Teen Wolf II for my daughter, and it kept deleting off my account for almost 4 months, and I had to purchase the season through ITunes so my daughter could watch them as they released. Amazon would not credit the season pass when it wouldn't work either. So I no longer purchase season passes or movies through Amazon, and I don't leave an active credit card on my account either. I now purchase movies, TV series, Books, and Games through ITunes to play on my IPad and ITouch. So far I have not had an issue with my purchases from ITunes or being overcharged.I use to buy everything through Amazon, but their lack of customer service or quality has gone down hill the past year. While the Kindles worked they were great, but for the cost I have spent replacing them, I could have purchased 2 more Ipads.
Reviews.Title: Doesnt Last Very Long

Reviews.Author: Doug
Reviews.Content: I'm new to pads. Bought my wife an iPad mini about a month ago. Had the Kindle for a couple of weeks now. I would give a slight edge to the Kindle on picture and sound quality. Unfortunately, it doesn't fair as well in most other categories. Processing power appears to be about 50% of the iPad's. Battery life is good (not as good as the iPad's) but it seems to use much more in sleep mode. The biggest surprise was WiFi performance. It is much slower than the iPad. I also give the iPad the edge on device navigation (ease of use). I was streaming a video today and had a total device lockup. And I do mean total. Couldn't even turn it off! Had to just set it down and wait for the battery to die. It was ok after that. If I had it to do over again, I would definitely go with another iPad.
Reviews.Title: Falls a little short

Reviews.Author: TB
Reviews.Content: My sister purchased this device for me last Christmas to help me get through final year of university. I call this review before and after because over time some of the features I loved have changed.Initially when I got the Kindle Fire HD 8.9" I was in love, the screen was beautiful, sound quality was amazing and it was so user intuitive. I'm a major media consumer so there was no other device for me. Movies looked gorgeous, books were crisp to read and songs sounded like I was in a concert hall. I could fill a medium sized conference room with my music. It also was light enough and the screen was large enough for me to study for hours on it. With a few simple apps I could review lecture notes and practice past paper questions. As another Christmas approaches I can't help but think back to where my device is coming from and compare that to where it is now.Now I still love my kindle, no other device allows me to share books and media with my family the way kindle does. They were all purchased by the same person so we can see what each person has read and share media on cloud. I just wish that the quality of the device had remained the same. My audio is inconsistent, the volume can audibly be heard to change in intensity without me adjusting the volume. In fact the device sounds muted overall compared to what it was initially. Every now and then the volume will chip in and sound as loud and clear as it once was but that happens infrequently. Another problem is that occasionally images remain on the screen even after I've switched to another page. This is particularly distressing because I end up with one image overlapping the other. I also can't predict when it is going to happen so for weeks I may enjoy good visual and then a couple days of overlapping images.I still rate this device as 4/5 because it has truly lived up to my expectations of it but the quality deteriorated. In fact as I typed this a spot on the screen that corresponded with the 'I' on the keypad became unresponsive for a few minutes. Go figure. If I wasnt such a lover of books I would probably rate this device lower...I honestly just wish my device would go back to working the way it used to and I don't have the money in my budget right now to get the HDX. Hope this review proves helpful and that Amazon will take note so this doesn't keep happening.-
Reviews.Title: Before and After

Reviews.Author: Snoopy1
Reviews.Content: The decision to go with an Amazon Kindle Fire HD (8.9") tablet versus an iPad or other tablet was admittedly heavily influenced by the amount of media that I had purchased from Amazon over time.  However, I still did my homework before I made the purchase including playing with both side by side for over an hour.  Since the iPad is the benchmark everyone seems to use, I will make some comparisons to that tablet.  First of all, the cost for a comparable tablet (I purchased a 32GB model) was considerably less for the Kindle Fire HD.  You only get the single camera with the Kindle Fire and the screen is smaller (8.9" versus 9.7" for the iPad) which wasn't a big factor for me.  What was a factor is that the Kindle Fire is lighter and a bit thinner, has dual Dolby speakers (compared to one for the iPad) and dual WiFi antennas.  The resolution on the new iPad is exceptional, but then again so is the Kindle Fire.  You need to compare them side by side to see if there is enough difference to justify the added cost of the iPad.  Battery life is advertised as about the same (11 hours for Kindle, 10 for iPad).  There are some minor design glitches on the Kindle Fire HD that have been covered in other reviews.  (1)The location of the power switch is not only hard to find, but you find yourself accidentally touching it frequently and turning off the tablet. I partially solved this problem by taking a silver marking pen and placing a dot next to where the power button is so that you don't have to turn the unit sideways to look for it and you can avoid it more easily with the dot marking the spot.  (2) the connection for the power cable is located at the bottom of the tablet (if you are holding the tablet horizontally).  If you are watching a movie and want to have the power cable connected, the plug rests on the surface which crimps the wire a bit and can't be good for the plug and wire.  I place two paperback books under the tablet at about the height of the plug which keeps it off the surface.  Obviously when you use the tablet on battery which is probably the majority of the time, this isn't an issue.  I have watched about 10 movies since I received my Kindle Fire and I must say that I am very impressed.  I have a high speed wireless internet connection (18 Mbs) and the movies are delivered without any pauses or jerky motions.  It is just like watching a movie on TV.  The sound is very good and the picture is truly HD quality.  Navigating around the Kindle Fire takes some practice.  The Help pages that Amazon provides are worth printing off for reference but still do not provide a full user's manual.  With time, I found that I liked how the screens were displayed and moving between the Amazon cloud and items loaded on the device a snap.  While it is not all totally intuitive, it doesn't take long to master the major steps to get through books, movies, etc.  Email was a little harder for me.  I have AT&T; (Uverse) email and there were some issues (for example not syncing contacts) that you won't face with something like gmail.  Finally, I saw a lot of comments on the case that is custom made for the Kindle Fire HD (about $54).  I didn't care whether it looked like leather or not.  I wanted something that had a custom fit look and protected my Kindle.  It does that.  The material it is made of looks more like a polycarbonate material and the cost is probably higher than it should be, but so far, I like it.  I have very little slippage problem when I stand it up on a hard surface.  Overall, I am very happy with my purchase and would recommend it to anyone that isn't an Apple fanatic.  I was all prepared to consider the new iPad, but I just didn't see enough difference that mattered to me to justify the added cost, but then each of you has your idea of what features matter the most.
Reviews.Title: Despite a few minor design flaws, the Kindle Fire HD is an exceptional tablet

Reviews.Author: AnnS
Reviews.Content: This is my third kindle and I am happier than ever! The sound is so much better than the earlier kindle. The picture is clear and the color brilliant. This kindle is totally worth the price and every bit as good as it is advertised!!
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9

Reviews.Author: Joseph A. Chitwood
Reviews.Content: This product is very well built. Very solid! There are a lot of features and apps available. So far, I am very happy with my purchase!Kindle Fire HD + Amazon Prime = Very Happy Wife
Reviews.Title: Very nice product

Reviews.Author: Shawn Chen "Shawn"
Reviews.Content: The OS is better than I expected and movie experience is super.The appstore is a little limited but it's easy to work around and side load install other apk files like Chrome/QQ/etc which makes it more useful.Overall i like it very much.
Reviews.Title: Great movie experience and good OS

Reviews.Author: Walker
Reviews.Content: I don't live online and don't have, want, or need a smart phone; but I do travel a lot and ride a motorcycle so wanted a tablet to have at hand without unpacking the laptop; so I narrowed it down to this and the Samsung Tab.  All-in-all I think I made a good choice with this Kindle 8.9HD WiFi.No problem with the mail setup, even with my business servers; The screen is great; movies and reading excellent; it's easy to setup and use; it's fast; FB, Twitter, and other apps are there & all work great (no FourSquare app available - but I wouldn't use it anyway).  There seem to be enough app's available to do pretty much everything I need especially ones' to support other file formats for things I need to have with me.  It would be nice if Amazon would play nicer with the android community for other "toys", but, I'm not going to lose sleep over it.However ... had I known, the deal-breaker would have been that there is no driver for voice navigation and speech-to-text, and it doesn't support the TCM apps (just means I'll eventually get something else unless they do a software update).  But it is exactly what they say it is and a great little high-quality tablet.  If you're not too demanding on all kinds of extras, this thing is perfect.
Reviews.Title: Not bad at all

Reviews.Author: Ginny from AZ
Reviews.Content: Having owned the Kindle 2nd generation I was really excited about getting my Kindle HD for my 70th BD.  I just have to learn all the ins and outs with it, but I am happy with the voice, internet, and can read my books in any light now.  I wish it had come with a manual, but expected that as the 2nd didn't either, so I have downloaded from the internet the info I need, so I can reference what I want to know.  I also found that some of the shop tv shows were showing it, and I learned a few things watching them. If I find I don't care about some things, I will come back and add more.  I was really excited that we could travel and I could use this as a computer and book, leaving the laptop for my husband to use.After almost a month, I LOVE THIS EVEN MORE.  So, unfortunately, does my husband.Sooo I bought him one for Christmas!  I don't like sharing!!!!I was so excited about this that I didn't look far enough to find that the manual is on it.  Don't hesitate.  Buy this!!!!Note:  Still loving it after 5 months.  I have also added word and downloaded documents from my computer to the Kindle so I could take to meetings.  Worked great.Still happy with my purchase.
Reviews.Title: Love It So Far

Reviews.Author: Cynthia Rogers
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love the kindle Fire HD 8.9".  I wanted something I could read on and get on the internet with.  It works great!
Reviews.Title: Love it!

Reviews.Author: evans
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as an upgrade from the original kindle and have been singing your praises all around. T he picture responsiveness are excellent! I used it to do lots of Christmas shopping due to its portability, and ease of use. Who needs an Ipad, I`m sticking with my Kindle :-)
Reviews.Title: beats the others hands down

Reviews.Author: Christy
Reviews.Content: I love the new kindle and now i will be able to skype with my kids.  I just need to learn how to do more things with it.  It should come with a book for dummies!
Reviews.Title: kindle fire hd

Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: Much debate between the Fire and iPad.  Graphics are outstanding and the physical thickness (overall size) is very similar to the iPad.  Overall, very pleased with the 9" Fire.
Reviews.Title: As advertised.

Reviews.Author: Shelley R Wiltrout
Reviews.Content: When my daughter's Kindle Fire went toes up, Amazon customer service offered an outstanding deal on a new Kindle Fire HD 8.9" The price was 25% less than the first generation Kindle Fire I was replacing. They promised it in two days, it showed up at the door less than 12 hours later. Shipping was so fast and efficient that I was unable to register and sync to her account as it wasn't to be delivered to the next day. Customer service was able to correct the shipping status so I could complete the registration. If you have a non-functional Kindle of any model or generation, give them a call they may offer discounted replacements.
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire bricked, Amazon offered a terrific deal on a replacement

Reviews.Author: lindamar
Reviews.Content: You didn't include the charging cord that plugs into an a/c outlet.  How can you manufacture an item and not include that as part of the purchase.  Very disappointed.  I called and they said it would cost an extra $20.00 more.  I was very impressed with amazon before always and having second thoughts about purchasing amazon electronics in the future.
Reviews.Title: Disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Jonathan G.
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet and I was torn between buying this, the Windows Surface, and the Ipad. I have used Ipads frequently, and have an Iphone so I'm used to the operating system so going that direction seemed the most logical however they are just so damned expensive. Upon reading lots of reviews, as well as trying out a few of my friends different tablets I decided I was going to get either the Kindle Fire HD 8.9" or the Kindle Fire HDX 7".  I liked the idea of having both the front and rear camera as well as the ability to download videos for prime in order to watch them without wifi, but decided I would try this first and upgrade in the future if I thought it was neccesary. All I can say is this does everything I need an more. I use it so much it has completely replaced the use of my PC. If you do your research there are plenty of "must have" apps out there that let you get the most out of your kindle fire.  I would also highly reccommend that you have an Amazon Prime account, otherwise you won't be able to fully utilize this tablet.You have have read reviews complaining about the advertising, that had me somewhat skeptical to begin with, but the complainers neglect to mention the advertisements are only on the locked screen. Whenever you turn on the kinle you see an advertisement and an unlock Icon. Once you swipe into your home screen there are no more ads to worry about. To me this isn't a big deal, and occasionally the ads are very interesting, such as a book or movie that Amazon wants to reccommend.As far as screen clarity, I can't tell a difference between this an ANY of the Ipads I have used (I haven't used the newest Ipad air yet) and the resolution is crystal clear. The volume is impressive for a device this size, and its amazingly light weight. I was suprised by how little it weighed when i first picked it up. The battery is impressive, when they say it lasts ten hours they mean it. I watched 6 hours of a TV series from the netflix app over 2 days without charging it, and still had about 20% battery life left.If you are new to the world of tablets and aren't going to be a "power user" this should be more than enough for you, and at a price that is much better than most of the other's out there.  Just remember to buy the "Amazon Kindle 9W PowerFast Adapter for Accelerated Charging" (the adapter to allow you to charge from an outlet rather than your computer) because it doesn't come standard with it.ENJOY!!
Reviews.Title: This is awesome!

Reviews.Author: Laura Loyd
Reviews.Content: I love my new kindle, it is great for surfing, games checking email in a flash. Very convenient and easy to use. The only downside is the battery life, not what I expected. The battery lasts more like 3 hrs instead of six or seven. As much as the kindle costs it should have came w/wall charger. Because I'm new at this  I wasted money on two usb chargers, finally went to Radio Shack n got a wall charger for $17. Charges way faster.
Reviews.Title: Love my kindle but battery life short!

Reviews.Author: Kevin Neathery "klneat777"
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to receive my Kindle Fire HD 8.9 on Father's Day 2013. I wanted it for its reader capacity but looked forward to using it to surf the Web. Boy, was I disappointed! Silk Browser freezes more often then works. There is certainly nothing "silky"about it. I have seen many others write the same criticism. Why will Amazon NOT address this issue with some sort of fix? I suppose their solution is to replace the whole thing with a new device and expect we who are stuck with one that will not access the web without freezing to buy the newest one. I would be most pleased to give this device 5 stars IF Amazon would update or replace this software since many, many people have this problem.
Reviews.Title: Silk browser is the worst

Reviews.Author: Maria
Reviews.Content: It will take time to learn to use all the features available, but it is worth the effort. I enjoy learning, so I'm up to the challenge and it gives me something to do during TV commercials:) I recommend downloading one of the free manuals for new Kindle Fire users. I'm using "Kindle Fire HD Manual--The Ultimate Kindle Fire HD Gide for Beginners" by Amber Norato.I bought the version with the Amazon ads, because it was less expensive and have no regrets. They only appear when you turn on the Kindle and once you unlock it they don't reappear.I took my time deciding which Kindle to purchase. I finally decided to buy the 8.9. I expected that it would do so much that it would replace my laptop, I was extremely disappointed within an hour of using it. It seemed that I could have gotten the same benefit with the $69 Kindle reader. Then it happened--Amazon began sending me offers for additional Apps--now I can do so much with it.There are many, many free Apps--games, printing, streaming, etc., etc. etc., so explore those first. I also got "tokens" for buying it that I can use to buy more apps. I'm also trying Amazon Prime for 30 days--movie and TV program streaming, but still undecided about it.I like that my Kindle has built in speakers, a great picture--I find it sharper than my HD TV. I leave the music playing in the background, while I explore other apps. Now what to do with my laptop???If you are buying this for a child, don't set up the "one-button payment" feature. It is easy to run up a large bill.You'll need to buy a charger, because it only comes with the USB cable.The next challenge was getting a case for it, without breaking the bank. I'm still waiting for the one I decided upon--$5.95 vs. another I saw for $54, so I can't make a recommendation right now. I also bought a stylus, because I hate to see fingerprints on my screen and because I press the wrong links when using my fingers. I sent for the Marware Stylus, based on reviews. It is expensive--$15, but sounds like the best one. I'll review it when I get it.I recommend assessing what you will do with the Kindle and using the comparison feature on Amazon, before buying. If you just want it as a reader, buy the $69 Kindle. Although the Kindle HD has beautiful color, the reader is black and white, which I like.Enjoy your Kindle, whichever you decide to get--I'm enjoying mine.
Reviews.Title: A progressive learning experience--like it more everyday--anticipate to love it in near future

Reviews.Author: C. Osman "Grandma"
Reviews.Content: I am quite disappointed with the charger.  I have it plugged in all night and open it and use it less than 1 hour and it tells me I need to charge it.  I had it replaced once and an finding the same problem with the second one.  There seems to be a known issue with this item.  If this is the case, it may have to go back.
Reviews.Title: Kindle FIre HD 8.9

Reviews.Author: Darren Gears
Reviews.Content: I did not need a tablet...i have a very new laptop and never found a need for a tablet. I decided i wanted one after playing with a display model in office depot simply wanted it to be "in" with the new app phenomena.  One year in now i look at my laptop with its inch of dust on it and just wonder why i didnt get a tablet sooner. The kindle fire hd is just awsome! It surfs thw internet fast. Netflix streams without a hiccup. Ebay is simplified,and ofcourse you got the kindle app store whixh has jsut about anything you will ever need.thebkoolest thing is i gave my tablet to my 56 year old stepdad and told him to have fun. He is a total tech novice and he got the hang of the kindle within 30minetes. I bring my tablet to work with me every single day to catch up on reading. I am a little sad to say i have read literaly 10 times as many books this year then in the last 7 years since i graduated from high school. I would recommend this for anyone who wants a great tablet but on a budget
Reviews.Title: one year in and i dont leave home without it

Reviews.Author: rae
Reviews.Content: I never leave home without it.  It's amazing all I can do on this device!  My on the go one stop entertainment!
Reviews.Title: Happy!!

Reviews.Author: Tomas
Reviews.Content: After owning and using a 7" Samsung Galaxy Tab 2, 9.7" Ipad, and now the 8.9" Kindle Fire HD I have to say with out a doubt, that the kindle is definitely the best machine for the price. Don't believe what others may say about android and apple having more apps. Kindle may not have as many in terms of shear quantity but it has everything one would need and the majority perform better than android. I still like some of the specialty apps ipad has but the need for most of them are very individualistic (your neighbor may need it but you don't). I rate the Kindle display the best of the them due to its color, definition, brightness and responsiveness. I also rate the network ability of the Kindle the best due to the MIMO built into it along with it's dual band ability. It can be put on your routers 5Ghz band while the other machines are using the 2.4Ghz band your in video and internet response heaven. Ipad has always been know for having difficulties in the dual band arena. The Kindle runs dual band with out any problems. It can even run both bands simultaneously switching between them to gain the best performance. Android gets a low third place.
Reviews.Title: Best for the Dollars Spent

Reviews.Author: Timrod
Reviews.Content: This tablet is great. I use this for everything I used to use my laptop for except for printing although I could probably do that too. I mainly use this for games and apps and have had very few minor problems. Nothing major. The only thing I would do different is get the WiFi/4G version. This is my third KF and I've liked them all.
Reviews.Title: Great!!!

Reviews.Author: debbie damron
Reviews.Content: A wonderful clear picture, easy to use and great apps.I love the bigger screen and the hd is a treat.
Reviews.Title: Everything it is advertised to be and more.

Reviews.Author: J. McCusker
Reviews.Content: I bought the Kindle because my wife's vision has been going down somewhat. After we learned how to use it she read a 485-page book which she previously had trouble reading before. She loves it.
Reviews.Title: My wife and Kindle

Reviews.Author: TJsMom12
Reviews.Content: I am thoroughly enjoying watching TV shows and movies which I did not think I would even be doing.  Of course reading books is great but having the ability to have them read to me is something I also did not realize I would be taking advantage of, the Text to Speech feature is a great.  It is nice to be able to review my email and FB from the comfort of my easy chair or out on my back deck instead of at my desk.  I am very happy with my purchase.
Reviews.Title: Having a lot of fun with my Kindle Fire H.D 8.9

Reviews.Author: Lois Ford
Reviews.Content: I was looking at the IPad, but I did not want to spend the extra $200 and a monthly fee for connectivity.  Since I already had the smaller Kindle and was very familiar with it, I decided to go with the KFHD 8".9, and I love it!  It's has a quicker  response to all appellations and the sound is much better!  I was going to give my smaller Kindle away, but I liked it so much, I decided to keep it too!
Reviews.Title: Bigger is Better!

Reviews.Author: Alan H Jamijian
Reviews.Content: This Kindle really is great. I bought this on preorder as a gift for my sister. She wanted to replace her old Kindle and wanted something she could use to browse the internet and watch movies.The Kindle is high quality, very easy to use, and has tremendous value when comparing it to the high prices of the iPad. The display is very sharp and clear. We have used it for reading, watching movies and the internet. No complaints!
Reviews.Title: Awesome

Reviews.Author: Rick Heartgraves
Reviews.Content: I love the size and the user friendly attributes of my Kindle Fire HD with LTE.  It was easy getting my email set up, getting my song from my desktop into the Amazon Cloud so I can access them on my Kindle.  The app selection is extensive and I love reading e-books on my Kindle.  The screen is very easy on the eye, just like reading a paper book.  For the price it’s a GREAT deal.  I specifically LOVE the LTE.  Having the ability to access the net, music, movies, email, and all that anywhere I’m at is GREAT.  I don’t have to rely on a Wi-Fi hot spot when I’m on the go.  The dual speakers are GREAT, the sound is very clear and my Kindle works great when I sync it to my ride.  I would definitely recommend the 8.9 Kindle Fire HD with LTE!
Reviews.Title: Movies, Music, Books and More on the GO!

Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure how I would like reading from the Kindle but have found that I love it.  I haven't gone much beyond reading books and facebook but am beginning to venture into unknown parts.  I am a senior citizen and have been somewhat reluctant to try something new but am finding this very pleasurable although as well as being a bit challenging.  Try it - you will like it!
Reviews.Title: Senior Citizen and the Kindle Fire

Reviews.Author: Kafficho
Reviews.Content: I am an avid KINDLE luv-er.  I have purchased 5 for myself and at least 6 for friends and family.  I like this product.  I also own two iPads and still think KINDLES are amazing.  With that said, after I purchased the Kindle listed above, I found I had some 'issues' that I didn't have with any of the others.1) The charging port (I am not terribly computer literate, so forgive me if I use the wrong terms...) is on the left side of the KINDLE.  It makes it difficult if you want to use the KINDLE while it's charging because you can't open the cover easily.  And, if it's closed when you start charging, you can't open the cover completely because it gets caught up on the cord.  The charging port is comfortably on the bottom of all my other KINDLES.2) The camera takes a picture facing you with no way to turn it out.  If I want to take a picture looking at something, I have to maneuver myself so that I'm twisted around looking at the screen so I can see if I'm taking the picture I want or simply aim and shoot and hope I get the picture I want.  The pictures are beautiful.  The configuration to take a picture, no so great.  I use my iPad to take tablet pictures.3) The power button on the bottom of the Kindle is narrow and close to the body of the KINDLE so it's hard to press and I'm never sure if I pressed it correctly.  (This is unlike the other KINDLES that have a nice little round button that you can feel comfortably and can tell when you press it.)  Unfortunately I have spent too much time pressing, waiting, pressing, waiting, pressing, waiting until the screen lights up.  I like the little easy to feel, easy to press buttons.  I also have some nerve damage in my fingers which make turning on the KINDLE a little more difficult.4)  The 4G LTE 'function'???  I thought this would make it possible to pick up the internet in locations where you can't get Wi-Fi, like you can get cell phones.  So far, not so much.  I've been disappointed.  I can see the bars (or icon) lit up indicating I have the 4G LTE service available, I think, but can't get the internet or anything else that I can't get on any of the other KINDLES.  Also, I'm paying a monthly fee for the service and don't think I'm getting my money's worth.  I probably won't continue this service when my current contract expires.  Note:  I am virtually ignorant regarding the 4G LTE world so I may simply not understand what it is, what it does and how to use it.  I'll give you that, so this comment may simply be exposing my ignorance.  But that's okay.  I'm fairly certain there are others of us out there who don't understand this stuff.  "Hi to you all!"I believe those are my 'issues'.  I am still sold on the KINDLE products and have continued to buy KINDLES for friends since I purchased this one.  I will continue to be an exuberant customer and talk up the product to everyone, but, the most expensive, fanciest one turns out to be the one I like least.Still, BUY A KINDLE, THEY'RE THE BEST!!!  You can't get a better quality or cost efficient product of this type anywhere.  Oh yeah, and your customer service is the GREATEST.  You can actually understand the folks who man your phones.  Yea!Happy KINDLE Shopping.  I don't think you can go wrong with the whole line of KINDLE PRODUCTS.  AND, I luv the high speed charger too!Sincerely,A very happy KINDLE shopper
Reviews.Title: Luv Kindles!!! but  have a couple of 'issues' with Kindle Fire HD 8.9" 4G LTE Wireless, Dolby Audio, Dual-Band Wi-Fi, 32 GB

Reviews.Author: Celia Maddox
Reviews.Content: The best choice in a tablet for me and my specific needs.  The only thing I did not notice before purchasing was that the camera is only front facing, which is not what I had wanted, however, everything else is great.  The ease of use and ability to work from this device (I am a Realtor) is tremendous.  Front picture quality is not good--very grainy looking. It has HD with Dolby speakers and could not believe how good it was in picture and sound when watching a video of a missed TV episode.  I do recommend this product highly, but beware you cannot take photos except front facing (when using Skype with family and friends).  If not for this I would rate it 5 stars!
Reviews.Title: My 2nd Kindle (HD 4G LTE with Dolby speakers

Reviews.Author: Lady with the Fidz
Reviews.Content: Having bought the first Kindle that came out - this was an upgrade for me.  I went with Amazon's since I have such a large Amazon library.I'm updating my review as my first Kindle stopped charging.  The sent a replacement - we will call it #2 for this review.#2 arrived and it's refurbished.  It would not download ANYTHING and constantly would start with the "orange circle" during videos - it was 12 times in the first two minutes of a show I had DOWNLOADED.  So, Amazon is okay, we will replace.#3 - this was GROSS.  The screen was so FILTHY and GREASY that I had to clean it three times to get it even to an acceptable point.  (Might I point out it was in a clean and new bag.) Then the color of the screen was a very dull BROWN (and no, I'm not color blind), the software update was really out of date and it would not allow me to update it.  Plus, there were features MISSING on #3 - and of course, it again didn't download.  So, Amazon is okay, we will replace with a "new one that will be perfect" - it arrived today.#4 - software is out of date but I have since learned how to do that myself.  The screen is again is a dull brown but that's not the worst part. This one on the left hand of the screen (no matter what orientation) has about 2 1/2 inches of darkness and a line going right down it. UNACCEPTABLE.When plugging it in to charge (to the Kindle Charger) the top part where it plugs in and the upper back left of the Kindle gets so hot you cannot touch it comfortably.Downloading and streaming videos if you don't mind only seeing part of the screen - well, doesn't work for me. I prefer to see the whole show....not part.However, the hot space from where it is charging and the area at the back of the Kindle does keep me warm.I was asked to give it one more try.  So, okay, Amazon, this is your LAST SHOT at getting me a Kindle that WORKS.
Reviews.Title: Kindle 8.9 - UPDATE 01 10 2014

Reviews.Author: wrhalver
Reviews.Content: My first experience in the Tablet world. Have had my Kindle for about three weeks now. I am accustomed to Android Smartphones and therefore Google Play. As mentioned in many of the other reviews, the world of Kindle does not include Google Play. But every app I use, or a similiar version of the app, can be found in the Amazon App store and 1 Mobile Market. And by the way, OfficeSuite and ES File Manager work with Google Drive. Other apps like X-Plore require a Google account, and some apps have partial functionality without the Google account. Also, the onboard Silk web browser does not support Flash. But nowadays many browsers don't. The Dolphin browser supports Flash and works great with my Kindle. I use the Dolphin browser most of the time. Learned this from my experiences with the Droid 2 and 4. My Kindle is protected with the Manvex cover. I am typing this review using the KT-1167 keyboard, and I use a capacitive stylus. If you have thick fingers the stylus will be used often. Still looking for a separate bluetooth mouse. Really don't want to use a trackpad that is part of a keyboard. I have made my investment into the world of the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 and so far I am not disappointed. Right price, right size screen, good audio quality. And when I don't have an available Wifi connection, I use FoxFi on my Droid 4. Very happy with this product, and my overall business relationship with Amazon.
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9 32GB

Reviews.Author: Emily
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loovve my kindle fire HD. I waited over a week to do this review because I didn't want it to be compromised due to my overall excitement. I was tied between a kindle fire HD and an iPad mini. After doing some research and making my pro/con list, kindle won due to its affordable price, I even got the 32GB. I am a huge fan of amazon and already own a kindle keyboard. Not really a fan of apple, the only apple product I own is an iPod touch that I got over 4 years ago.The display of the kindle fire HD is AH-MAZING. I was blown away at the crisp display. It makes everything look good, even the font! I find myself watching movies/shows on it rather than my 46 inch screen TV because I am just mesmerized by the display. There are plenty of apps. Since I don't own many apple products I don't have anything else to compare the apps too, but I am satisfied with what is given. Reading on the kindle fire is amazing as well, I am an avid reader so this is a huge plus. Upgrading from the kindle keyboard to the fire's back light did take some adjusting but after a day or two of reading I was comfortable with it. It has pretty cool features too such as seeing how much of the book is left displayed on the bottom of the screen and it also states up many more minutes till the next chapter! As well as some other new kinks. The speakers are nice and clear, although I wish they were a bit louder, I understand it's not suppose to be a stereo but slighter volume would of been a plus. The web experience is very nice, but it does lack flash. I heard there is a way around that, but it doesn't bother me (yet). Since I got the kindle (about 8 days ago) the web page crashed only once and that's because I had a lot of things going on at once (7+ pages open + pandora)...They don't include a charger in the package which I think was a HUGE mistake on amazons part. The Amazon Kindle Power Fast adapter is a NECESSITY unless you want to wait 16+ hours to get your kindle charged. I used my other kindle adapter and only had it changed at 50% after 9 hours and drained to 15% after two hours of use. The very next day I went and got this charger, now it takes 6-7 hours for a full charge and the charge can last an entire day to two days depending on what you are using the kindle for.Since I got the kindle fire HD I also signed up for amazon prime to get the full experience. There are plenty of free shows and movies to watch! I just wish the kindle lending wasn't restricted to one book per month :(Overall I give this product a 4.5 rating and recommend it to everyone.
Reviews.Title: LOVE LOVE LOVE

Reviews.Author: Delisa Renideo
Reviews.Content: I've had 3 other Kindle's and loved them all, but this one is great for the way I use it.I still use my original Kindle Fire when reading in bed because it is easier to hold than this bigger Kindle.However, there are some wonderful things I love about this Kindle. I use it as my portable computer.  I take it with me into the kitchen and I can listen or watch various webinars or other programs I subscribe to. I hook it up to a speaker system in order to hear it better, although the speakers in the Kindle are much better than the ones in my Kindle Fire.I use it to check my email, and I can also easily respond to my email because I bought the Belkin Keyboard and Case, so it's much easier to type on it than with the virtual keyboard.One thing I DON'T like is that it isn't designed to be able to use Flash, and I use that a lot to access the videos in the webinars.  I was finally able to access Flash using a work-around. I had to go to YouTube to find out how!  I ended up downloading Dolphin as my browser so I could download Flash. I now have it and it works great, but it sure seems like it should have been integrated into the Kindle from the beginning.I love the portability of the Kindle, especially since I use it as a computer much of the time.I also love that this model includes the text to voice feature, so I can have my books read to me while I'm working in the kitchen or driving.It's easy to use, and easy to get around. I find it quite intuitive.  I wish there were better instructions that came with it, but I was able to download a Kindle book of instructions for a small price -- about $2.99 I think. That was helpful.As I said in the beginning, I still use my other Kindle for some of my reading just because the smaller size is easier to hold. But when I'm traveling, this Kindle is perfect as I can read my books (or listen to them) as well as access email and the Internet. I love it!
Reviews.Title: I LOVE My Kindle!

Reviews.Author: Donald W Savage
Reviews.Content: We have earlier Kindles, but purchased this one for myself because of the larger screen and the ability to stream movies from our Prime account.  It has lived up to all my expectations.  Have also loaded serveral great apps...Weather channel, CNN, USAToday and the MapsWithMe.  Used the Kindle on a recent trip to Europe instead of taking my laptop (never missed the laptop...the Kindle handled everything).  Great riding on a bus in Croatia and understanding everything about our route from the MapsWithMe.
Reviews.Title: Great device

Reviews.Author: M.Worrell
Reviews.Content: I don't like committing to sticking with one company's proprietary content when purchasing electronics. To me it's like buying a record player that will only play one label's records. Here's why Amazon won me over:- I can sideload apps. Barnes and Noble forced my switch from a Nook Tablet to the Kindle Fire when they updated their device to block sideloaded apps. I hate being chained against my will to a company's logo, and being told what I can do with my own tablet. If you've invested in a library for the Nook, you can read those books on your Fire via the Nook app. Most other apps I've tried that for whatever reason are not in the Amazon app store seem to run fine.- I can sideload legally purchased content I ripped/stripped myself, and it's easy. If you're up for learning how, you can find a way to get all your existing content onto the Fire, with covers that show on your shelf, etc.- Amazon is simply the best online bookstore. If you have Prime, with all the accompanying perks, you'll be very happy with Amazon's content on other fronts. And with free shipping you can save a lot of money on ordinary purchases.- The performance of the Kindle Fire hardware is excellent. Lightweight, looks great, sounds great, very responsive.The only reason I gave the device four stars instead of five is the interface. The "carousel" is just a big, dumb nothing, and it's right in your face. I would MUCH rather have a few screens that I can populate with my favorite apps and content as I see fit, and have the carousel accessible but otherwise hidden.
Reviews.Title: Excellent Tablet and Content Universe

Reviews.Author: eaks0719
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet for my Mother for Mother’s day. I wanted to get her a tablet that had a great HD screen, was easy to use and wasn’t too expensive. My mom is not tech savvy so I thought getting her a higher-end more competitive tablet (ipad, surface, etc.) would be a waste because she wouldn’t use it to its potential.She absolutely loves it!!! I spent time setting it up and helped her understand how to use it. This does not come with a paper manual, but it has a quick tutorial when you start it up and there is a manual on the tablet if you need one to use.`The Short Answer:Yes, I would recommend this tablet to someone who is:a.New to tabletsb.Someone who is not tech savvyc.Someone who wants an excellent eReaderd.Someone who casually uses computers and would like to have a tabletDon’t get this tablet if you must have the latest and greatest in apps (the app store is limited & no Google play store) or you want an android tablet that you can customize to your own preference.I would also let someone know while recommending this tablet that it does NOT come with the wall charger only the USB chord to connect to a computer to charge and the charging time can be a long time. But if you want to wait and see if you must have it or need it I have seen them for sale at the big box stores that sell kindles (I saw it for sure at office depot and at best buy), so if you don’t get it, it shouldn’t be too difficult to get it should you decide it’s something you need.Also, it comes with ads that show on it and you can remove them for an extra $15 either at the point of sale or later. Since this was a gift, I left the ads on there (as I understand some people don’t mind them while others are very against them) but I did include an amazon gift card so if my mom wanted to remove them she wouldn’t have to spend her own money.How I decided on this tablet:I did some research online – the biggest selling point was the screen. I figured that my mom would use it more to read books and watch movies & TV shows, she may play some games from the app store but nothing too complex.The next thing I did was go and find one to try out at a major box store. I watched some movie trailers and played some games, went through the demo, read some paragraphs got on the internet and it was wonderful for what it would be used for. I wanted to get a good idea of how it would function and run so that when my Mom got hers and we fired it up I would know if it was working fine or not.I cannot stress “try it before you buy it” enough.  If you aren’t sure or do not have any experience with tablets go to the store and try them out! If you have questions, ask – even though this isn’t as expensive as some other tablets, it is still a major purchase and you want to make sure you make the correct decision.
Reviews.Title: Perfect Mother's Day Gift :)

Reviews.Author: Michael Gray
Reviews.Content: Got this for Christmas and wanted to wait 6 months before reviewing. Not so sure we will make it that long, so here goes.When everything works properly I love this pad. Just the right size, great sound and good color.Battery life is OK some of the time but can be inconsistent. That is the first problem. I have gone to bed without charging, as I thought there was plenty of power left, just to wake up to a dead unit. Charges pretty quick, but I like to be able to use it first thing when I get up.The second major problem is the browser. It constantly tells me tabs are not responding and offers to restart them. Most of the time there appears to be no problem with what I am viewing, but the notification pops right up in the middle of the page blocking what I am reading. Sometimes this will happen several times while attempting to read a single paragraph of text.Finally the pad will sometimes just freeze. This mostly again seems to be related to Silk when using the browser directly or when redirected by some apps. Keep in mind also that there are limited apps available and many do not seem well developed to work with the Kindle Fire or it's browser.In the last month or so all of these problems seem to be getting worse so that is why I thought it wise to review at this time. We still have some good days but the devices performance is just too inconsistent to warrant more than 2 stars.Update 7/31/13After writing my review I was contacted by Amazon customer service. They had some suggestions and talked me through them. They said they would call back in a few days. They never called back. What they had me do wiped all my data from Silk. Their suggestion to turn the device off to save battery just makes the pad less convenient to pick up and use and has done nothing to improve battery drain in use or efficiency in charging. The final problem has been that frequently when using Silk the pad will just reboot.Now the good news. Did a little online research and found that some Google apps can be side loaded. I now have Google Chrome for my browser and the Maps app. I'm not a big fan of Chrome but it does sync with Chrome on my PC and android phone. The pad no longer reboots for no reason. Still get an occasional freeze but rarely.I would consider adding a star if I had not been required to fix all this myself. Also the battery problem has not improved much. I am trying the new battery saver app for Kindle but so far I don't think it's doing much. I'm also using the new Mobile Desktop app and love it. You still have to go through the carousel to get to it but from there it's great.If this thing makes it to a year I might add a star yet. If Amazon would admit they have problems and make efforts to correct them they could get another star for sure. They could start by allowing all Google apps and play store.
Reviews.Title: love hate relationship

Reviews.Author: Marguerite Wihby
Reviews.Content: I have used an I pad before. This far exceeds my expectation. It is also much cost effective.I like that I can stay connected to facebook, Skype etc;I highly recommend.My only down side is the quality of the audio used in Skype.
Reviews.Title: First Class

Reviews.Author: Sprkymrt
Reviews.Content: I already had a Kindle 3G with the 7" screen, so I wanted to get the Fire 8.9 with the larger screen and color.  This has exceeded my expectations and I am very well satisfied with it.  I have the one with Special Offers, and while that can irritate some people, I have ordered a few of them.  My Kindle has mostly music and books on it, and speaking of books, this is great for getting ones that have any pictures, maps or diagrams in it, which held me back on the other one, although that is fine for reading novels and books that don't contain photos.  The speakers are very good, and I can download content  from the internet and Amazon without any trouble.  I have my email on here and get a notification whenever something comes in.  Games can be had from simple ones for kids to the more complicated ones for teens and older people.  I have a few of the larger games on mine but right now I seem to be stuck playing mahjong, but that will wear off eventually.
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 8.9 Review

Reviews.Author: wendy
Reviews.Content: This is the best purchase I have ever made, it does everything it is supose to do. Clear pictures. I would recommend this to anyone who is looking for a Kindle.
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 8.9 4G Wireless

Reviews.Author: mommywsej
Reviews.Content: I was trying to decide between a kindle or an ipad. I wasnt very familiar with a kindle at the time. I had used an ipad and liked it ok. One big issue was price. An ipad is very expensive. The kindle is a great value that offers as much or more than the ipad. I am glad I chose the Kindle. I got the 8.9 inch kindle fire HD. I made the right choice!
Reviews.Title: The right choice

Reviews.Author: Vivek Mehra
Reviews.Content: I am fully satisfied with this Kindle fire HD as it is a nice piece of technology & it has good surround sound , i like it more than the I pads people have been carrying around me....excellent product , value for money, definately would refer to my freinds
Reviews.Title: Excellent piece of technology better than an I pad, very good dolby surround sound.

Reviews.Author: Wraith Kitten "Spooky"
Reviews.Content: Having the original Fire, I fell in serious crush mode. Then I got the HD 8.9 in my hands...I fell in love and am so glad I splurged, I treated myself to the 8.9! The screen is so clear and crisp, the touch screen works better with a stylus and the sound is awesome. Watching movies is more engaging, games are realistic and did I mention the sound quality.I highly recommend the HD 8.9 as a more versital Tablet, the Fire HD is not just for reading anymore!!!
Reviews.Title: OMGoodness!!!

Reviews.Author: Michael Avallone "Obiwopkenobi"
Reviews.Content: I knew I would love the Kindle Fire HD. I have now put it through its paces over the last couple of days and can only come up with two minor things that could have been done better. The first thing is the charging input. I would have put this on the side since when I have it in its case the charging cable is in the way. I actually have to flip it over and sit the case the other way so the cable is now technically coming out of the top.The second thing is taking pictures. Since this baby takes pretty nice pictures, why on Earth do I have to point the screen at the subject? There should be a second camera on the back of the Kindle. I can't for the life of me understand why this was left out. It couldn't have cost that much more to add a second camera. My thinking is this will get an upgrade down the road.Other than that the Kindle rocks.
Reviews.Title: Almost perfect

Reviews.Author: Amber R Burkhart
Reviews.Content: Awesome! Thanks got this for my hubby as an anniversary gift. He's an OTR truck driver. He loves it! :)
Reviews.Title: Amazing

Reviews.Author: Robert Pizzino
Reviews.Content: I finally took the plunge after vacillating for a couple years over a tablet. Very glad I chose the Kindle Fire !
Reviews.Title: Love, love, love it !!

Reviews.Author: famof5
Reviews.Content: Been doing count down until I could upgrade to kindle 8.9. Now i have it and love it twice as much as my first kindle. Amazing speed and picture. Loved my first worship my new one. If you are addicted to amazon as me then kindle it now!
Reviews.Title: yeah

Reviews.Author: smey2183
Reviews.Content: My husband got the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 for me for Christmas. I was super excited! But i noticed from the moment i started using it that something was wrong with the power button. It kept sticking and sometimes i couldnt even press it to make the screen turn on and off. I contacted Amazon and they were more than helpful. No questions asked, they sent me a new Kindle and it arrived 1 day after i called. I boxed up my old one and sent it back. And the new one they sent me works perfect. It was a very smooth transaction. And since they didnt hesitate to send me a new one, that made it even better. Graphics on the Kindle are amazing. Couldnt be happier with everything that if offers!
Reviews.Title: More than happy!

Reviews.Author: Gayle Patton
Reviews.Content: I love it!  The picture is so awesome.  I love watching movies on the Kindle HD!This is a great product!
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD

Reviews.Author: Greg Kahler
Reviews.Content: I've figured out exactly why I LOVE my Kindle Fire so much. Ever watch Inspector Gadget? I have wanted a book like Penny's ever since the first episode I watched. Now I do have that Magic Book! Thank You Amazon Kindle Fire for bringing a little girl's dreams to life as an adult!
Reviews.Title: Dream Come True

Reviews.Author: Prince
Reviews.Content: Wanted to get a tablet for my mother-in-law. Based on her computing and entertainment needs, this new Kindle was the perfect tablet for her. I saw Amazon had a one day sale for the unit at $249. No where else could I find this tablet for that price (and still can't).Great device, easy to use and WHAT A DEAL!!
Reviews.Title: Cool tablet - awesome price

Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I thought about getting an Ipad mini then I decided to check the HD Kindle and it the ideal tablet if you want to watch movies,and it really is.
Reviews.Title: It's Awesome

Reviews.Author: Cowgirl Miller
Reviews.Content: i purchased the first kindle fire when it came out a while back and i love it.  decided to bite the bullet and buy the new Kindle Fire 4G HD 8.9" and after a week I'm loving loving loving it.  I was pleasantly surprised that all my aps from my first kindle were automatically loaded to the new one.  Set up was super easy as was getting the AT&T; 4G internet going.  This fire does everything its advertised to and is very user friendly. only drawback is that there is no capability to take video or pictures....hopefully the next version has that. I suggest buying the case with it - well worth the money.
Reviews.Title: second kindle fire and love them both

Reviews.Author: C. Costello "crcostel"
Reviews.Content: I got this tablet as a Christmas present. I came into it knowing about the issues that most people write/complain about (charger, flash etc)-ScreenThe screen is all its cracked up to be. Colors are vibrant, text is crisp. Viewing web pages is a pleasure, as it watching videos or reading books.-SoundThe Sound is fine. No one will mistake your KF for a home theater system but it sounds fine and really, what else can you expect from a tablet.-DesignYes, the button placement could be better. The tablet was clearly geared to be held landscape because the buttons are on the short side, with the micro-USB on the long side. I would suggest putting the volume and power on different sides on the next generation and making them slightly bigger. That being said I can still work all of the functions with ease. As stated above the screen is excellent and the processor seems good enough.-InterfaceAs anyone who reads this should know, KF runs a customized Android (ICS) interface. I'm not too fond of the carousel but I can make it work. It would have been nice for Amazon to give us more options for the layout (ie no carousel, change the layout of the tabs or drop some).-AppsNo there is no google store. It's no surprise, Amazon makes no money on the hardware, so they need to be the one selling you apps. It doesn't have all the android apps that I want yet. I suspect it will eventually. To me, this feels like early android in that regard. I have side-loaded Dolphin, Flash and Youtube. I highly recommend the Dolphin browser. If you don't like Silk, google how to get Dolphin-Web browsingPages are rendered quickly and easily on Dolphin. I have reasonably fast internet and have seen no real difference between page loading on my laptop vs KFHD-TypingTyping by and large works fine. It is certainly not a physical keyboard but its a lot easier than typing on my android phone.-Overall-This is a solid 4 star tablet. If Amazon works on increasing available apps and working out the bugs I could give it an extra .25 star. Ditto for more customization. But in the last 2 weeks I can count on one hand the number of times I took out my laptop. That should tell you how well the KF is working out for me.BTW I would *not* pay to remove ads. The ones that appear on your homescreen, you can remove for free in settings. You can pay $15 to remove lockscreen ads but I don't mind them at all and sometimes you get free vouchers.
Reviews.Title: KFHD 8.9 after 2 weeks

Reviews.Author: Linda
Reviews.Content: Not being to computer savey, I had my reservations but told myself I must try.  It came all ready to go, walk through directions as soon as you turn it on.  It was SO EASY and simple to understand and no directions book to fumble through. Handy books and movies and games when the grandchildren visit. Highly reccomment for any age level.
Reviews.Title: I LOVE, LOVE IT

Reviews.Author: Clem
Reviews.Content: Just received my new Kindle Fire HD, and I must give Amazon kudos.  My device was supposed to arrive on January3, but on the 4th I got a message from the shipper saying that my package was lost.  In short, I contacted Amazon to see what would happen next.  A replacement Kindle was sent out that Friday afternoon with a courtesy Saturday delivery.  I received the package before 10:30 A.M!Fast, excellent screen, great audio for its size. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a tablet that won't break the bank, but delivers great content.Compared to my Kindle Fire, I would say this is a great leap forward.  The HD movies are crisp and clear,and the HD audio really surprised me.  Setting up Wi-Fi was very easy, as was setting up my email accounts.  One great addition is the ability to have the Kindle read your books.  It's not the greatest text-to-speech I have ever heard, but it is clear enough for me to understand.I will continue to use the Kindle Fire HD and add updates as i become more familiar with it.
Reviews.Title: Excellent Device!

Reviews.Author: M. E. Bradley "mcmerb"
Reviews.Content: Of course, I'm loving this Kindle Fire. It provides the daily news, email, RSS feeds, tons of books, movies and music (beautifully),work with documents, interaction with all my social networks - and it doesn't give me any backtalk unless I want it. It allows me to play games with my friends - and with it - and never rubs it in when I lose. I received my Kindle Fire HD 8.9 for Christmas and have just begun to explore its capabilities, We should have an exciting future together.
Reviews.Title: perfect companion

Reviews.Author: Monica Alston "aintgonbeg"
Reviews.Content: I recieved the Kindle Fire 8.9 w/4g lte for Christmas. First of all the colors are awesome!!! Even clearer brighter than the Kindle Fire 7". Playing games is a treat;the graphics are out of this world!! The At&t; 4g is fast too. You cant beat the price either $49.99 for 250mbs for 12 months and you purchase more if you need more. But this works for me because I have Wifi at home so use the 4g at work only.This fire is bigger than  I expected too.I love the camera it takes great pictures. I loved how all I had to was sign in and all of my stuff from my other Fire was instantly there. I was very much pleased Amazon you got it right this time!!
Reviews.Title: Wow!!! Better than I expected!!
