Reviews.Author: JR
Reviews.Content: I purchased for my father for Christmas. He loves this tablet. I did my homework and with price not an issue, I chose this over the iPad. I'm really glad I did.
Reviews.Title: Awesome tablet

Reviews.Author: John S. Linton "John"
Reviews.Content: I bought this with the intention of getting new graphic novels which are hard to get in my town. The comics look great and are very clear. Videos look great and they sound is excellent. One thing I did not like is the update just did its self.
Reviews.Title: Love the size!

Reviews.Author: carol hill
Reviews.Content: I had an older Kindle with buttons and a tablet. When I saw the Kindle fire it would combine the two. Also, like the high definition and many other features.
Reviews.Title: I like my Kindle Fire

Reviews.Author: Karen Edgecombe
Reviews.Content: I had my first Kindle for over two years, and used it all the time.  I could not wait for the new one to come out, and I find that I absolutely love it! The color is beautiful, and I like the additional features that were not on my other Kindle.
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD Dolby Audio, Dual-Bank Wi-Fi , 16 GB

Reviews.Author: rebecca
Reviews.Content: I am thrilled with  with everything EXCEPT..The fact the BATTERY LIFE. It always seems to die after a few hours even.if it has been charging over night. I still feel this tablet is the Greatest for less money This is my 4 kindle and am giving my husband one for Christmas I Can`t wait.
Reviews.Title: KINDLEFIRE HD

Reviews.Author: thecowboy56
Reviews.Content: The Kindle HD 8.9 was much more than I ever expected. It is so much more than a fancy e reader. Thanks!
Reviews.Title: Way better than I expected!!

Reviews.Author: Sharon A. Francis "wishing it"
Reviews.Content: WOW... I had the first Kindle Fire.  This is just sogreat ..  Clear picture. Larger screen.  Games areamazing.  love it.
Reviews.Title: New Kindle Fire HD 8.9"

Reviews.Author: chuck bottom
Reviews.Content: it is just great. i had the other kindle and upgraded because of the web this one has.i love to see the book covers.i just wish that in the discriptions the books,they would state how bad the language is.i wont buy more from an author that uses the Lord' s name so horriblly.other than that this is wonderful.
Reviews.Title: great

Reviews.Author: Nancy R.
Reviews.Content: I love it!. This tablet has met and exceeded my expectations.There is nothing I want a tablet for that this product will not do.
Reviews.Title: Everything I want & needed in a tablet/e-reader.

Reviews.Author: Fyrluna1
Reviews.Content: I'm so glad I decided to splurge and buy this for myself.  I've had the 3G Kindle for three years so that I wouldn't have to keep buying books.  I've not only been able to read a book, but I've found fun games and I've watched some videos.  The picture quality is great.  Best purchase I've made in a long time.
Reviews.Title: Love it!

Reviews.Author: Debra
Reviews.Content: Love, love, love my new Kindle!Only one disappointment! When we skype our grandchildren in Nevada, the picture isn't clear, it's fuzzy! Would appreciate it if that feature could be corrected somehow! Otherwise, we love our Kindle!  D.T.
Reviews.Title: My new Kindle Fire HD

Reviews.Author: janice399 "JM"
Reviews.Content: The first generation fire I had was used all the time and I did not want to upgrade. Then I saw one of these 8.9 fire hd in a store an was hooked. This 8.9 hd fire is easy to use because the touch screen is a huge improvement on my last fire. The typewriter responds accurately and it was used type this review. Videos look and sound great. I have only read a page or two in my book so far because I keep wanting to explore the applications.
Reviews.Title: Nice tablet from good company

Reviews.Author: DONNA M GILCHRIST
Reviews.Content: I love my new Kindle, still learning more about it everyday...I love being able to put it in my purse and take it to work or on trips.
Reviews.Title: My New Kindle...

Reviews.Author: sunsine
Reviews.Content: Just set up her account so it's all ready for use when she opens it in 13days!Seems to work great, arrived fast.
Reviews.Title: Xmas Gift for our daughter

Reviews.Author: Wilcie
Reviews.Content: I like it but I'm still trying the different "Apps". I have read several books.Today I downloaded the camera.
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9

Reviews.Author: Teracia Loretan
Reviews.Content: awesome product however it should come with an easy start up  guide just to give you a few quick tips and by that i ment on paper not e book
Reviews.Title: awesome kindle

Reviews.Author: Susan
Reviews.Content: I really love this product (and the Kindle Fire basic from last year)It's convenient that it connects to free games/books using Amazon services and is easy to use.
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD

Reviews.Author: Stephen Piersall
Reviews.Content: LOVE IT! The bigger screen is better to view everything you do. A bit heavier but then again it's bigger. Battery life is longer then the original Kindle Fire.
Reviews.Title: New Kindle HD

Reviews.Author: Robert J. Griffin "jeepbob1"
Reviews.Content: mine landed yesterday and in 15 minutes we were completely operational along w/ 40 books and other stuff from my kindle DX sooo thanks and we r sooo happy w/ our investment n Merry Christmas dev team :)
Reviews.Title: wow this is Amazing technology

Reviews.Author: Bizzle
Reviews.Content: I fly twice a week. I needed something compact but was put off by the ipad's price point. The screen is a beauty when streaming in HD. It's a really great way to integrate all of your amazon media and I like the layout. Silk is still a bit buggy but I expect that will improve. Hoping to see more apps get incorporated onto the platform. Speakers are pretty excellent and the hdmi socket is a huge plus for connecting to hotel TVs. Battery live goes quickly with movies and depending on your charger, you might have to put your kindle to sleep. If you're not a Maccolyte, the kindle's price should get you what you need.
Reviews.Title: A Must Have for Travelers

Reviews.Author: Jose Garcia
Reviews.Content: ahhhh the Kindle Fire HD 8.9/ What can I say about this beauty. This is Very well made. Doesnt have that cheap plastic feel to it like other tablets and phones do. It is pretty thin, but heavy enough to know its durable. Very sexy look to it. I love the HDMI out feature. Battery life is decent. screen resolution is AMAZING. very very clear. I could watch it all day. Screen is a great size too. I don't have anything bad to say about this besides the obvious lack of apps and games (since it uses the amazon store and not the google play store) but it has more than enough to keep me entertained for a long time. combined with amazon prime, this tablet is a keeper for me. AMAZING DEVICE.
Reviews.Title: I am IN LOVE

Reviews.Author: MEH
Reviews.Content: I JUST GOT MY FOURTH KINDLE.  KINDLE FIRE HD 8.9.  I LOVE IT!  MY FIRST TWO KINDLE'S  (GENERATION ONE AND TWO), WENT TO MY KIDS, THEY UPGRADED AND GAVE THE FIRST TWO TO THEIR KIDS.  MY THIRD KINDLE, (KINDLE FIRE) WENT TO MY HUSBAND, WHO BY THE WAY SAID HE DIDN'T NEED ONE, WOULDN'T USE IT,  BUT SPENT THREE HOURS ON IT LAST NIGHT AND REFUSES TO PASS IT ON.  MY KINDLE FIRE HD 8.9, 16 GB HAS FANTASTIC COLOR, DIMENSIONS, GRAPHICS,  AND FEATURES (BUT) THE INSTRUCTIONS ARE SOME WHAT HELPFUL BUT NOT DETAILED ENOUGH FOR ME FOR SO I'M GOING TO GET THE COPY FOR DUMMIES.  TRANSFERRING AND DOWNLOADING TOOK A FEW CALLS TO AMAZON BUT LIKE I SAID I NEED DUMMIES INSTRUCTIONS.  I DON'T LIKE THE SUGGESTED ITEMS WHERE THEY ARE BUT I DO LIKE THEM.  I MISS THE BOOKCASE LOOK ON HOME  PAGE BUT NO BIGGY. THE BIGGEST ISSUE TO ME IS LACK OF THE CLICKING SOUND WHEN YOU TYPE ON THE SCREEN KEYBOARD BUT I STILL LOVE IT
Reviews.Title: my 4th kindle

Reviews.Author: Carol from Chelmsford
Reviews.Content: I wanted the bigger screen as an ereader even though a Kindle rep told me once that the Kindle Paperwhite is the best ereader.  I love my Paperwhite as well.  I wish it came in the larger size like the Kindle Fire HD 8.9".  I use the Web feature on the Kindle Fire as well even though my iPhone does a good job as well.  I think I'm a technology junkie!  Only complaint is that it is so heavy but it does so much, I guess it has to be.
Reviews.Title: Love My Kindle Fire HD 8.9"!

Reviews.Author: surgee
Reviews.Content: MY NEW KINDLE IS WONDERFUL. THE SOUND IS GOOD.  OPERATION IS GOOD. LOVE ALL THE FREE APPS.  WI-FI IS PRETTY FAST.
Reviews.Title: LOVE

Reviews.Author: Mohan Sitlani
Reviews.Content: Frequent "web page not available."Silk browser quits frequently.Poor customer service - many transfers without satisfactory end results.I recently had corneal transplant surgery that degraded my vision, making it difficult to view.  As Amazon refund, an upgrade to the Fire HEX should would be reasonable resolution.  Although I offered to pay the price difference, your customer "service"was unreasonably intransigent.For now I am using my wife's iPad.M.  Sitlani
Reviews.Title: Disappointed

Reviews.Author: John R. Mccutcheon
Reviews.Content: I sent it back as for that kind of money you would think it could do more things, as it would not even play a slideshow on my homepage.
Reviews.Title: sucked

Reviews.Author: Alecia
Reviews.Content: This is my second kindle fire HD8.9 in 3 months and I just got this 2 days ago and it looks like it's going to break the same way my 1st one broke. First the charger port where the kindle charger plugs in gets all lose and then eventually breaks off in there. Then it becomes unchargeable. It has come to the point where I am afraid to plug and unplug it. I can't believe it's only been 48 hours and it is already wiggily. I can't say I'm happy about this in fact I think it is the worst place for the charger as it is on the bottom when playing most games and apps it should be on the side then it wouldn't be bumped or in the way I am starting to consider returning it all together and getting a tablet that supports google play because they have better apps and games
Reviews.Title: problems with charger port

Reviews.Author: M. Shikibu
Reviews.Content: I have the first Kindle ever made, but I wanted the color format and web capacity, so I got this one.  I hate this thing and wish I'd purchased a different one.  First of all, I guess I didn't pay close enough attention to the description because I really wasn't aware that you had to have a known Wi-Fi connection to make it work.  I thought it would be like the original one, and work anywhere.  Secondly, it has to be constantly fed electricity, or the battery goes down.  And finally, it's constantly crashing.  And I mean constantly.  My advice would be to spend a little more and get a better one;  this one is buggy, etc.
Reviews.Title: Wish I bought a different Kindle

Reviews.Author: Sandy Doepker
Reviews.Content: First 30 days seemed to be no problems. Now the screen freezes up and apps do not respond, ie candy crush and words with friends. I will be calling customer service soon!!
Reviews.Title: Apps not reponding

Reviews.Author: Steve Hostetter
Reviews.Content: Read Amazon's claim that the internet browsing was faster than Ipad with "Ultra-fast Wi-Fi" due to the dual antennas.  Horribly slow!  The three iPads that we have (including a first generation) are all faster.  The internet browser that comes installed on the Kindle is Silk - consistently unresponsive and I have to frequently close the window.  Can't remove Silk and replace with Chrome.  The screen is clear, but that is about it.  The power and volume buttons are on the bottom of the tablet, so when browsing in the "landscape" orientation, it is very easy to hit the buttons thus turning off the device.  Very disappointing!Bottom line ... for a few dollars more, I'd purchase a refurbished iPad
Reviews.Title: Stick with iPad

Reviews.Author: mjm "rigbycorp"
Reviews.Content: You'll be much better off with a Samsung, Asus, or even an iPad (although admittedly, iPads are more costly, and you can't expand the storage space; but you can't do that with the kindle either). The web browser (Silk) is lousy, and most others popular browsers aren't compatible. Amazon made their version of android more proprietary than other tablets, and its not very customizable. Finding files isn't easy, and they often end up where you wouldn't expect them. I'll get videos in the photo app, and not be able to move them. I get the wrong artwork for my music files, and can't change it. The only thing I like is, I have Amazon prime, and I can connect the kindle to my flat screen, and stream movies. I will not buy another one though. It's becoming much easier to stream with other tablets now. Btw, I've had this tablet for a couple of years now, so this review is based on a lot of use.
Reviews.Title: Don't bother...

Reviews.Author: Heather
Reviews.Content: I can't stand it when people give something a negative review just because they received a defective item, or the shipping didn't come or something that doesn't really tell you about the actual working product. Well, this review isn't one of those.I never thought I would say this...as I really have tried so hard to avoid being one of "those people," but after using the Kindle Fire, it's safe to say, yes, I am an Apple person.Right now I am using the iPhone 5, and the Kindle HD 8.9, and there is just no comparison when it comes to the quality. The following is a brief bullet pointed list of problems I have with the Kindle, that I do not have on the iPhone:- The glare. Oh god, the glare!!! Isn't this device advertised as being better than the iPad when it comes to glare? I don't see how that can be possible, because looking at this screen is like looking in the mirror. That is how reflective it is. And if you should want to watch a movie or tv show that's primarily dark, well good luck, because you're basically going to be staring at yourself for the next hour or two. IT IS TERRIBLE!- Startup. Start up is sloooooooow. I mean, this thing takes minutes to start up. And even then, once it's actually started, it's gonna take another few minutes to wait in order to pull up any of the apps, otherwise they will just freeze and/or crash. Best thing to do when you want to use it is press the start key, and then walk away and come back in another 15 minutes. Then you should finally be good to go.- App availability. It's really unfair to yourself to ever purchase and Apple product and then get a device that is going to use an android app, because let's face it - we all know there are a million more apps for Apple. That said, I thought there would still be a decent enough amount of apps to choose from on the Kindle, being that Amazon owns the other half of our world. Nope. Not even close. I looked up the apps I have on my Apple, and only was able to find about 1/8 of them. Let me repeat - about 1/8. That is unreal, and frankly, unacceptable. The entire device is built around apps, therefore one would expect there to be a decent amount.- App functionality. The few apps I have been able to find and download regularly freeze and crash, and are generally much slower than Apple apps to start up. Some of them were in fact so unreliable that I ended up just deleting them.- Customizable options. Ummm, yeah...there aren't any. At all. Being somewhat tech savvy, I enjoy the ability to greatly customize my devices. I choose different backgrounds, different start up screens, password protect my devices, etc. That I have found, you can do NONE of that on the Kindle. You're basically stuck with that glaring black background, and that stupid "carousel" app display.- Sound. The sound stinks as well. If you want to watch or listen to anything, just plan on having to turn the volume up all the way. And that's in a quiet, child-free household. If you have children or a loud house, just plan on not being able to hear it at all.- Buttons. If you can find the buttons, good luck pressing the right one. Half the time I press the shut down button trying to press the volume because they put all three of them right in a row. I get that they were trying to make the buttons blend in with the device for sleekness, but sometimes functionality over looks is the better way to go.Basically, I will use this thing until I can save up enough for an iPad. That's how terrible I think it is - and it is brand new. Do yourself a favor and save up a little extra cash and get the iPad. You won't be sorry!
Reviews.Title: Not a negative review about product not working

Reviews.Author: Amazonette
Reviews.Content: Because I love my Kindle Paperwhite, I decided to buy a Kindle Fire HD last May before a trip so I could access my email, newspaper, and travel arrangements along the way. I had read dozens of user reviews in advance and really, really wanted to like it. Unfortunately, probably because I was not yet familiar enough with it, relying on it caused me to miss a crucial email and a long-awaited meeting. This one was my bad, not Kindle's.Back home, I started using it more and found it difficult or impossible to access the online versions of my mail subscriptions. A magazine sample downloaded from Amazon Kindle site froze at 48% and did not let me advance. First star lost. Accessing my Gmail account was still cumbersome -- second star lost. For me, it was best for reading books: the vertical page size is about the same as a paper book's, and an off-white background selection is easy on the eyes.Now comes the function that dropped the third star: it goes dead frequently and is a hassle to revive. The first time it happened, the user guide was useless and online instructions did not work. I had to contact Kindle Help who walked me through it on two calls, one hour apart. The second time around, I followed the steps that Kindle Help had shown me. Again, it took an hour to revive it. Too labor intensive for me! I want something that comes to life when I plug it in to recharge it. Preferably something with a clear on-off button and a power indicator like my laptop and my phone.Kindle Fire may be an excellent tablet for most users, just not for me. I need something that makes it easy to read my newspaper and magazine subscriptions and access email. It also has to be available when I need it without an hour-long multi-step revival process. I guess I have been spoiled by the ease of using and recharging cellular phones and laptops. After eight months of intermittent use and comparing notes with savvy friends, I have concluded that an up-to-date smartphone and a 13-inch notebook will bridge all my needs, and I no longer even need a tablet. For reading books, Kindle PaperWhite is still the best.
Reviews.Title: Disappointed

Reviews.Author: Jolene Wipf
Reviews.Content: I love my new Kindle Fire. Kindles are proof of how computers are becoming a thing of the past. For example, desktops were replaced by laptops in terms of popularity because laptops are smaller and more portable. Now laptops seem big and bulky to carry compared to tablets such as the Kindle. Amazon has created the Kindle to do everything a laptop can do. The graphics are outstanding. The Kindle is easy to use with options for everything on the home screen. Examples of these options include books, magazines, the web, and several more.All users have to do is click one of these options and they will get to where they need to go.I predict that people will eventually use only tablets such as the Kindle. In fact, if my laptop ever dies, I will not replace it. Instead, I will just rely on my Kindle.
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9

Reviews.Author: BigBamBam
Reviews.Content: I had the 2nd generation Kindle Fire HD loved it. Now there's more to love. Added a few more capabilities and larger screen to what I was so happy with in my old Fire HD. Love the available option of having a wireless keyboard at the ready, added convenience. Screen size is ideal, larger but not a 10in tablet, easily fits into my purse. I upgraded to give my son my Fire HD which is optimal for him at its 7.3in size. We're all very happy, very contented with the Kindle and its operating system. An 8in to 9in screen size in my opinion is where its at for portability, weight, and viewing comfort. If your happy with any other Kindle but want a bigger screen, and  more options then this just maybe the ticket. Cheers
Reviews.Title: More Kindle to love

Reviews.Author: Tim Risher
Reviews.Content: This is my second Kindle Fire HD 8.9 inch; the first one locked up on the second day and would not come back on. . . even after I followed the troubleshooting guide at Amazon's website. The replacement process went well and worked just as advertized. The replacement tablet was apparently used/refurbished, but it works like it should. I just received notification that the original was received at Amazon.I also purchased the Kindle Fire HD Standing Leather Case. It fits the case well, and as others have noted, it puts the Kindle to sleep when closed. It doesn't appear to protect the Kindle well. I don't plan to drop the tablet, but accidents happen. The less expensive case appears to be sturdier and definitely provides greater protection of the corners against falls. I may exchange the more expensive case for the less expensive case while I still can.
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9 inch

Reviews.Author: Dizzy Lizzy
Reviews.Content: I think the Kindle Fire is the best thing I ever bought!  It does just about everything (except the camera is not that great) and more! I take with me wherever I go. Even doctors have asked me about it! When I tell them how much I love it, the next time I see them, they tell me I was right and how they don't need a computer when you have a Kindle Fire. Get your Kindle Fire today!
Reviews.Title: WONDERFUL TABLET!!

Reviews.Author: Aubree.Portune
Reviews.Content: Better than an Ipad! I love my new Kindle, works great, has a long lasting battery! Now my whole family owns a Kindle Fire!
Reviews.Title: Fun and Easy to use!

Reviews.Author: Victoria Close
Reviews.Content: My husband purchased this for me for my Birthday, and I am thrilled with it! As an avid book reader, this was the perfect gift! I not only use it to read, but I also use it to watch my favorite shows on Netflix at night (must have a Netflix account) while I am trying to go to sleep. I love the 8.9" size, because while it may be a bit more "bulky" than the smaller sizes, I like having the bigger screen.We did have an issue with the first one we purchased; the Kindle overheated and shut off, and would not come back on for quite some time. Amazon promptly replaced it, and I have not had a problem at all with this second one. (I believe the first one had a faulty battery?)Overall, I am more than happy with my Kindle Fire!
Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle Fire!

Reviews.Author: mike lovejoy
Reviews.Content: Excellent  video and sound,  easy to use,  being able to increase print  size is great. Able to use when away from home is a plus.
Reviews.Title: excellent  for reading.

Reviews.Author: Joan Groff
Reviews.Content: I have an IPAd and I am satisfied with this Kindle in comparison. I feels that it has a lot to offer for the differe nice in price.
Reviews.Title: Satisfied Customer

Reviews.Author: Dan Kasten
Reviews.Content: Kindle Fire meets my needs for a tablet. I can easily take it with me and use it for email and for a reader.
Reviews.Title: Kindle HD

Reviews.Author: Jeanne Fitch
Reviews.Content: So easy to read, lighting works fine. Like being able to read emails without being tied to the computer. I am a novice on all the electronic devices out there, but works for me.
Reviews.Title: Love It!

Reviews.Author: S. Camfield
Reviews.Content: I have a fused back that does not allow me to carry books.  I love, Love, LOVE my Kindle because I am able to never run out of reading material, music or videos as I ride the bus to work. It is so lightweight, my back does not  feel a thing from ALL the content I have in the various libraries!  Gotta love technology!!
Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle

Reviews.Author: SurreallyReal
Reviews.Content: Am unsure how much better the HDX will be over the HD with 4GLTE, but I am VERY HAPPY with this Kindle Fire HD.  Got the full 64GB and 4GLTE and it is FAST and really as much of a tablet as MOST people will ever need.  Of course, you MUST do your due diligence and research, BUT for a 70-year old who has NOT used a PC in over a decade, THIS is a perfect tablet to move up from a regular Kindle.  This is for my Mom's use and SHE LOVES IT!  Uses it in airports, on trains and hotels.  She watches Netflix, reads books and checks email - all without needing instructions all the time.  It is a nice, intuitive interface that is easy to understand and use. Of course, GET THE STYLUS, GET THE FAST CHARGER, GET THE STANDING LEATHER CASE, GET THE CLEAR PROTECTOR and lastly, if a car is ever involved with the one using this, GET THE CAR CHARGER.  It'll all add up, BUT it is all worth it.  I HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT, if you can swing the cost for all the add-ons, otherwise it'll be challenging to use without it all.
Reviews.Title: Souped-Up Kindle Fire HD Costs a Lot, BUT IT IS WORTH IT!

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I love this Kindle Fire HD 8.9!!! I am a die hard fan of the Kindle fire. As a matter of fact I purchased 6 of the original Kindle Fires. Four of them were for adults and the other two were for my 6 year old son and my 4 year old grandson. This was the best investment I have ever purchased for entertainment. At least that is what I thought! Then the Kindle fire HD 8.9 came out. I have purchased 3 KF HD 8.9s and one Kindle Fire HD. They are the GREATEST. The HD is awesome for viewing movies and videos. The images are so sharp! I love the apps that are available in the Kindle store. My son is able to use his Kindle Fire HD for play and learning. I recommend this product to all. I also purchased one for my mom. She is in her 60's and she absolutely loves hers. I really don't have any complaints at this time. I purchased the extended warranties for all of them. I had to have my son's KF HD 8.9 replaced because he dropped it and broke the screen. The replacement process was easy and fast. So as you can tell I am one happy customer. This is a must buy for ALL!!!!!!
Reviews.Title: Love this tablet. Best investment!!!!!

Reviews.Author: Donna Wynn "Retired RN on a spiritual journey."
Reviews.Content: I'm not real happy with kindle 8.9  I had it only about 6 months, didn't use it a lot this is my 3rd kindle which I had no problems with my other 2.  I went on vacation and took my kindle and I couldn't keep it charged so I didn't use it.  After I got home I called Amazon and it was replaced right away, other than that it's still working fine.
Reviews.Title: Battery problems

Reviews.Author: Stevo
Reviews.Content: As far as video, this tablet is amazing, you download movies and shows that are very easy to watch later. If it gets too full you just do a total reset and all of yor apps etc are still in the cloud to download. Much more functional than an ipad which gets filled up very quickly and cant hold more than a couple movies, if that. Great apps for audio such as podcasts.
Reviews.Title: This tablet is amazing.

Reviews.Author: Tara
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a cool tablet for a lower price than the iPad, this is it. I love the quality and the ability to do anything and everything on this.
Reviews.Title: fantastic tablet

Reviews.Author: Bryan
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD 8.9" 4G LTE Wireless has all the bells and whistles for the casual user. But the best feature is the built in Amazon app. Add in the Prime account and there isn't a better deal out there. I'm so impressed with the tablet that I'm going to preorder the Kindle Fire HDX 8.9" 4G LTE Wireless. I'll have to hand this tablet off to one of the family!
Reviews.Title: I absolutely love this tablet!

Reviews.Author: CC "CC"
Reviews.Content: I love the Kindle Fire 8.9! It does everything I want it to do. The color and projection is excellent. It has an HD display, which enables excellent viewing of movies downloaded from Amazon Prime. It syncs my Kindle library across my devices, and displays my photos and music. It enables me to check my email accounts and surf the NET. If I had it to do again, I would definitely purchase the Fire over any other tablet.However, the additional cost for me, of the 4G LTE was an unnecessary expense. WiFi alone would have been just fine. Actually using the 4G LTE would require the additional expense of a data plan as what comes with the Kindle is totally inadequate for any reasonable user.
Reviews.Title: Love the Kindle Fire 8.9

Reviews.Author: renee lindquist
Reviews.Content: I am completely satisfied with this 8.9 Kindle version.  I primarily use it for entertainment / leisure activities like web surfing, reading, games and movies.  But now I'm using the kindle to play more music.  It has great speakers for such a small component.  The high definition screen is impressive as well.  I watch my Boston Red Sox using the At Bat app and the MLB TV subscription.  The games look ok but not great.  I'm thinking I need to increase my internet speed with my ISP.  I would definitely recommend this Kindle for anyone that wants a great inexpensive tablet.  I own the original b/w kindle as well as the kindle fire.  I was satisfied with those products; but this 8.9 version is clearly a couple notches superior to those, but without a significant increase in price.  Exceeds my expectations in every way!
Reviews.Title: Very Impressive!

Reviews.Author: M Komar
Reviews.Content: If there were 10 stars, I probably would have rated it 10 !!  It is so nice.  The HD is great!  The speakers are nice too, for a tablet.  I just thoroughly love the convenience of it also.  I used to use my laptop in bed, now just use my Kindle Fire 8.9.  I find myself not using my laptops near as much.  My grandkids were here visiting over the week and they hardly put it down.  Now they want one!!!  I got the leather stand up case with it and it works great!.  The one thing that I was disappointed in so far is that there are no flash players that you can get to work on it.  That has only affected the videos that I try to play on Facebook so far.  Most everything else plays great!  ( youtube, videos, movies, hulu, netflix is not affected by this)  I called Amazon and they said they are working on that.  Overall it is great!  I love the size. A rear facing camera would be nice in the future!
Reviews.Title: Love, Love, Love it!!!

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Shiny glass creates a glare (affecting those around me) when lights hit it.  Other than that, I love the overall experience of this new Kindle.
Reviews.Title: Love the large screen

Reviews.Author: Gee Gee
Reviews.Content: After finally giving in to the obvious advantages of an e-reader over a printed book, I bought my first Kindle, the Wi-Fi, 6" E Ink Display in 2011.After reading several books on my first Kindle, I rapidly stopped being a "printed page purist!" So, in 2012 I bought the Kindle Fire 7" with LCD Display.Now, in 2013, I just bought the Kindle Fire HD 8.9" Tablet Wi-Fi, 8 GB and am very happy with the progressive technological advances over my first Kindle! The HD display is crisp, the colors are vivid and with Amazon Prime, I can catch-up on movies and TV shows. The "special offers" don't bother me and the lower price was worth the "annoyance."You might have noticed that I buy a new Kindle every year...which is true. However, the technology gets better with each Kindle so I will probably keep buying a new one every year. I de-register the old Kindles and donate them to the local women's shelter, so they are not going to waste.Next time, however, I will buy the accessories on e-Bay where they are substantially cheaper!
Reviews.Title: My third Kindle and loving it!

Reviews.Author: Winston
Reviews.Content: Amazon really stepped up their game from the original Kindle Fire. The display on this thing looks great, and let me tell you, the 8.9'' is a nice size. I love the fact that I can now use the Kindle Lender's Library, and get a free book once a month! So long to high costs of books (although I still do buy new releases occasionally). Also, I love viewing my amazon video on this tablet, AND shopping on it is a great experience. A+ Amazon product.
Reviews.Title: WOW!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Author: Marcelle A Cary
Reviews.Content: This device is perfect I take it everywhere and I am able to read at the Beauty shop,the car wash, and Starbucks
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire

Reviews.Author: William D. Risen
Reviews.Content: It has to be charged each and every night or I run out of charge the next day.  I like the back light for reading in the dark.
Reviews.Title: I expected better battery life.

Reviews.Author: D. Hanscom
Reviews.Content: I've been considering this purchase for a while now and I'm glad I followed through on it.  I've read some negative reviews with comments about how difficult it was to set the kindle fire HD up and get it to register with the system and all that but I have to say that I had mine connected with wifi, my books downloaded and even a few movies copied over off my PC in well under an hr.I like pretty much everything about the Kindle Fire HD 8.9.Its very light weight, easy to hold on to, its very comfortable in the hand and the display is fantastic I just finished watching an HD copy of episode 1 of under the dome and it was very pleasant watching it on the kindles HD display, the colors were vibrant, the picture beyond reproach and the sound was very impressive for a small device like the Kindle HD 8.9I'll be using it mainly to watch video as I have another kindle that I will keep for reading my books.I would highly recommend the Kindle Fire HD 8.9" over an Ipad any day.
Reviews.Title: Got my Kindle Fire HD 8.9" today

Reviews.Author: Shellianne Bowens
Reviews.Content: Bought it for my daughter as a graduation present from the fifth grade as she was an awesome student and daughter. It has met and surpassed all my expectations and not to mention that my daughter loves it.
Reviews.Title: Great Buy

Reviews.Author: Mujervieja
Reviews.Content: There are some features that are confusing to access.  I have a problem with my A T & T 4G.  My old Kindle had 3G and it worked fine in my home.  The 4G feature works occasionally but most of the time it doesn't.
Reviews.Title: Fire HD 8.9 4G

Reviews.Author: Nancy L Roos
Reviews.Content: This is a great tablet.  I have a netbook, which is approximately the same size only thicker and heavier with its own carrying case which I have taken on trips.  The tablet fits into my purse, so is much easier to travel with.  The tablet holds a charge for much longer than the netbook, too.  I am very pleased with it.
Reviews.Title: Lives Up To My Expectations

Reviews.Author: Karin J.
Reviews.Content: It took me forever to decide what kind of tablet to buy, and I am glad I decided to go with Kindle, and the large one. Extremely clear graphics, quick to load on my wifi, and even playing games, using internet, and reading it holds a charge for a long, long time. By long I mean constant play/read and it will only be down to maybe 60% after 8-10 hours. Sturdy and reliable.
Reviews.Title: I LOVE MY KINDLE

Reviews.Author: Thomas Brey
Reviews.Content: I have used a couple of tablets by now, and this one rates about in the middle.The good things:  I am an Amazon Prime member, and there is a lot of free content associated with that.  You can 'borrow' books and watch a lot of good movies and TV shows.  I also have a lot of music on the Amazon cloud, and it is super simple to handle music that way.  Also same for pictures.  The HD videos are especially good.The not so good:  The navigation is poor.  It does work, but not nearly as well as other tablets, especially compared to the iPad. Clicking a link is often difficult, and I generally have to embiggen the screen to do it.  The interface to the apps is very cumbersome, and often takes several clicks to swipes to get to the one you want.  Also, there are a lot of apps that just are not available on the Kindle Fire.  Even when I know there is an android version, that does not mean there is a version for the Kindle Fire.I will keep this and use it, but it falls a little short of expectations.
Reviews.Title: It works ok, but nothing special

Reviews.Author: Marvin Q. Miller "Marv Miller"
Reviews.Content: Screen resolution is better then the old kindle fire but the processor still seems slow. Battery life is awful and unlike the Ipad does not show progress when charging. all in all it's probably worth the 269.00 purchase price but it definetly needs some improvements.
Reviews.Title: Good but not great

Reviews.Author: Cedarkroft
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD 8.9" is my third Kindle, the original 7" Kindle Fire was gifted as was the second 7" Kindle Fire HD. IMO the Kindle Fire HD's are one the best entertainment tablet devices available at a relatively reasonable price.  From reviews I've read I think people have to understand that Kindle is an entertainment device and not a Windows type functioning device an therefore has limited Office/ Business uses.
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9" 32 GB

Reviews.Author: yxhzbq
Reviews.Content: Didn't think I'd be much of a tablet person but I love the kindle fire HD.  I got it for my little one and now I am considering getting one for myself.
Reviews.Title: excellent!

Reviews.Author: Floyd E. Catt
Reviews.Content: I am 75 years old and have some interesting eye issues.  Reading a real book requires just the right amount of light or I have problems. The Kindle 8.9 works great for me.  The default font is more than adequate for me to read for hours.  I did tone the screen down a bit by going to the sepia mode.  The page size as it turns out is much the same as a hardback book and using a stylus makes page turning a using the dictionary a snap!I was a Communications Engineer and a very technical person so I struggled for some time as to what I should buy.  i.e., a reader, black and white or color and reader or multipurpose tablet.  After much pondering over what to do, I finally decided the Kindle Fire HD met my needs very well.  I decide my main objective was to have a reader so why not buy a device that it's primary design was to be a reader.  Kindle does this very well but to my surprise it also functions very well as a tablet to visit the internet.  It will not replace a high end tablet but for $269 it does a great job and meets all of my needs.  If I were still working I might consider the high end tablet route but for me at this time the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 is great.
Reviews.Title: Great for old eyes

Reviews.Author: Terry Sue
Reviews.Content: Reading a book at low light is so easy! The soundtracks of movies sound much fuller than what I expected! Everyday I am learning new things that my Kindle can do!  I am pleased that I chose the larger model as it gives me more viewing space!
Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle Fire HD 8.9" !

Reviews.Author: Dogs Rule!
Reviews.Content: I have several versions of the Kindle and am a fan.  Once I received the HD large version, though, I have to say I am totally hooked.  The screen and clarity are great. I use it for email, online work, social media and the occasional video plus Words with Friends.  I like that it is a little smaller than the iPad and easier to stow in my purse, but large enough for everything!  This one has a camera, too!
Reviews.Title: Use it Every Day

Reviews.Author: Jeanie Matthews
Reviews.Content: I've been waiting for the "perfect" device for me and this was it!  It was priced right and highly rated (and I now know why)  it's very "user friendly", especially for us "untechie" types.  I've been juggling between the "Nook", a "Notepad" and a "Laptop", but this fullfills all my needs, i.e., email, internet, books.  My granddaughters love the games I can download so it also keeps them entertained!
Reviews.Title: Was exactly what I've been looking for!

Reviews.Author: nick76r
Reviews.Content: I got the kindle hd 8.9 for the kids.... to entertain them with games, netflix, prime movies/shows, during road trips (using my phones wifi hotspot) or other times when i need them occupied. The only complaint (minor) is that the hd isn't really that great of high def... its a little misleading. I remember commercials on tv before i purchased it, bragging how clear the screen was compared to an apple ipad. What I mean is that the screen resolution or definition isn't that much more noticeably better than the first gen kindle fire. An example: my 5 year old & I watch a few funny youtube videos before his bedtime, and the screen resolution is much better and more clear on my samsung galaxy s 3. I can hardly stand watching youtube or other streaming vids from the internet because the picture quality is grainy and blocky (?). And that is with using high speed wifi internet in my house! Needless to say, we stopped watching bedtime youtubes on the kindle hd and only watch them on my cell phone.  But, the size, apps, and convenience is great. General websurfing and email is pretty much the only reason i purchased this device. Overall, I am very happy with the purchase. Glad I didn't spend several hundred more for an ipad. If Amazon keeps their technology advancing and competitive, I will continue to be a customer.5 stars because it delivered exactly what I expected and its a good value for what I paid. If I expected crystal clear youtube videos ( which I didn't ), I would have paid 3 times as much or more for apple or some other top shelf brand.
Reviews.Title: kindle fire hd 8.9 16gb good for the money

Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: I bought the larger kindle fire hd for my wife and she loves the quality of the graphics. The kindle is set-up to the user with apps and other information on the home page. The size is just large enough to view but also allows it to be carried in a purse. Great buy would recommend it for the family.
Reviews.Title: Great tablet

Reviews.Author: Kay Parlapiano
Reviews.Content: I can download books at a very rapid rate. Actually, it's amazing how fast books are downloaded. I love it
Reviews.Title: Rapid download

Reviews.Author: jt04320
Reviews.Content: I'm an Apple lover.. However, I can honestly say that I enjoy the Kindle Fire with 8.9" display a little better than the newest generation of iPad. Let's be real, if you own an iPhone, you basically have an iPad. The picture quality of the Kindle Fire is undeniable and in stunning HD. The sound quality on the Kindle is outstanding! It is absolutely perfect for Netflix, Hulu+, or audio books. The tablet is quick and and easy to use. I'm currently still figuring out things here and there. All-in-all, it is a recommended purchase that I think everyone would enjoy. The price cannot be beat! You're getting a lot for you money. I highly recommend this product.
Reviews.Title: Love it!

Reviews.Author: Laura
Reviews.Content: The only thing I would warn other customers about is the camera is front-facing.Otherwise,if that's not a deal-breaker,it's a great tablet.It actually does more than I originally thought.More like a laptop/notebook than a reader.And I originally owned a 7" Fire wi-fi edition before this purchase.I thought that was a terrific product.I use the new 9" Fire HD for just about everything.Only use laptop about once every 2 weeks out of necessity due to personal & business programming on laptop.This is a great product.You don't have to be a reader to appreciate it's various uses.
Reviews.Title: Great!Love It!

Reviews.Author: A mom who like educational toys "Stacie"
Reviews.Content: I didn't think I'd like a Kindle.... because there is something about holding a book in your hand and turning the pages.  However, when the Kindle Fire (with the backlit feature) came out, I thought I'd give it a try.  I've now purchased several... for myself, my kids, and my parents.  IKindle Fire in general:  It's so nice to be able to read in bed with the lights out, buy a book at 10 pm, and not have stacks of books sitting around cluttering up my shelf.  I love listening to the music as I lay in bed with my preschooler.  And it's just handy to have everything.... games, apps, books, music, etc. in one place.Kindle Fire HD 8.9:  This is the best one yet!  I didn't think I would like the bigger size, but I do.  And it's got numerous additional features over the Kindle Fire... including easier online access and my favorite, Kindle Free Time for my preschooler, which allows you to set limits on videos, apps, and general play and provides a ton of content for my 4 year old in a controlled environment.  It is beyond great!  Really really love it and would highly recommend this product to anyone!
Reviews.Title: I didn't think it could get better than the Kindle Fire, but it did!

Reviews.Author: Jon Anda
Reviews.Content: I have had all generations of the iPad (including most recently the Retina, which I just gave to my wife).  I switched to the Kindle Fire 8.9 HD because of the way magazines and newspapers are formatted (i.e. clear index and perfect reading layout of each article), the ease of emailing in PDFs and then reading them in Kindle or the Adobe App (where they automatically show up), and the ability to easily hold the 8.9 in one hand without a case.  If you have a laptop and an iPhone as I do, the new Kindle 8.9 is a perfect in between for users who read a lot.  And if you want some tunes while you are reading, Amazon's music product is pretty good (not to mention plenty of storage options for those who want some movies or TV handy for plane rides).Since I plan on sticking with the Kindle 8.9 platform for a long time, I do look forward to a few improvements on version 2.0.  First, I think the processor is a touch slow, especially using the Silk browser - version 2.0 should make Silk feel "quick".  Second, I wish Amazon had MOG quality downloads available for music (or even the MOG app available).  Over time, Amazon certainly wants to be a leading seller of music/streaming and, after listening to hi-quality MOG or Apple Lossless, the Kindle 8.9 tunes sound a bit lame.  Lastly, while I love the Kindle reading products, there is less you can do with an article than on iPad - Kindle needs more tools to forward, post, copy, and highlight.  Sure some of these are available for some products (like highlighting in Kindle books, for example) but the Newsstand offers almost nothing (you can't even save articles anywhere).So it's a great reading device - great enough to make me swap out an iPad Retina - but it's my guess/hope that v 2.0 will be the ultimate (for me anyway).
Reviews.Title: Great tablet for readers

Reviews.Author: Barbara J. Hayes
Reviews.Content: I like  the kindle fire HD 8.9.  I just wish it had flash player and the Google app store.  also an instruction book instead of it being on the kindle.  When you are trying to do something you cant read it and do it at the same time.
Reviews.Title: Like it

Reviews.Author: Gary Powell
Reviews.Content: My first step into the 21st century, and what a great one it is.  I was skeptical if I would like this, but the quality and clarity of this device is outstanding.  I particularly like the easy readability of the 8.9 screen.  This is a great value for the price.
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD

Reviews.Author: Julian Mathias
Reviews.Content: My first impression of the Kindle fire HD was pleasant. The built quality looks and feels good and the device has a nice rubberized back that feels good in the hand. The user interface and functionality of the Kindle uses an Amazon software overlay, but the user experience feels very android-like once apps are installed.I noticed that PDF's and PPT files lag a little on the device. Sometimes I have to touch the screen multiple times to get the home button to appear in order to exit the PDF viewing program. Most other apps have run well with little hiccups.My only true complaint is that my screen has dead pixels. For most people a dead pixel is unnoticeable, but it is annoying for users who view a lot of PDF's or read books with a white background. I constantly find myself wiping the screen trying to get rid of speck. I called Amazon and was sent a replacement Kindle which also contained a dead pixel, this time in the center of the screen. Most companies allow a certain number of LCD display defects to pass through inspection since LCD's are an expensive component to replace. With the Kindle priced so attractively I understand that quality control would be set with tolerances that allowed for small variations that most consumers wouldn't notice or be concerned with.In short, I like the device. I think it's great addition to add to the Amazon ecosystem, especially if you purchase a lot of content through Amazon. I like the price point. Is the Kindle as good as an Ipad? Most would say no. Is it more than half as good as an Ipad? Certainly. And considering the price point it is a much better value.Are the components for the Kindle sourced cheaply? Probably- most device components are. Will this result in dead pixels on your Kindle screen? So far for me it has.I will call Amazon today and see what my options are. If I can't get a device I am happy with then I will return. For most, I think the complaints I described above would not impact most of the Kindles uses, especially watching movies and playing games.
Reviews.Title: Great Tablet for Amazon Content.

Reviews.Author: Joan V. Miller
Reviews.Content: I don't have time to play with it as much as I wish. But all the features truly meet the marketing claims. It is what I take with me whenever I'm going away for a little rest and relaxation (too seldom).
Reviews.Title: What's to say!

Reviews.Author: Alexis
Reviews.Content: So after two months of use, I am ready to talk about why I like this product so much.First of all, if you are tablet shopping, you really only need to ask yourself which ecosystem you like best: Apple, Amazon, or Google. You won't go wrong with any tablets that these companies offer, they're all wonderful devices. That said, I would have preferred a Nexus 10, but for a college student's budget, the kindle fire was an easy choice.If there is anything that the Fire falls short in, it would be the app selection. I mean, nothing really critical is missing (except for YouTube seriously Amazon get a proper YouTube app already) so it isn't really detrimental, but there are a few apps I wish Amazon offered.Other than that, everything works flawlessly. As a previous reviewer stated, the position of the micro usb port is a major pain, but little I can do about it. Books, movies, music, apps, games; the Fire can do anything the iPad can, despite what the rabid fanatics tell you.The true power user will probably want to invest in a Nexus, but for the money, this is a great media consumption device. I wasn't looking to replace my brand new laptop anyway. I can manage my emails, check mission critical websites, and get most of my day to day activities done fine on my Fire. It's my best morning coffee buddy.Also no, it does not come with a charger, but I knew that beforehand because I read. That college education sure comes in handy, don't it. If you do not do your research, do not whine to all in sundry about information widely and readily available. Also they aren't expensive and are sold at many brick and mortar stores.Well that wraps up what I have to say about my favorite toy. Take it for what it's worth to you, and happy surfing.
Reviews.Title: Why the kindle fire is my tablet of choice

Reviews.Author: Adore Yourself
Reviews.Content: I actually got tears in my eyes today at the amazing beauty of my Kindle. It truly is amazing. I have Amazon Prime and was sick in bed today and it was a sheet joy to have the Kindle to help me get through the day in bed. I was stunned at how simple and easy streaming shows was on the Kindle, I watched episodes of NOVA today seamlessly. I also am impressed with the sound and picture quality. It did not feel like I was using a small device at all. I love how the cloud makes it easy to get my books from my old Kindle and music I bought in the past into the new one. I think the Prime idea with the streaming content is going to get bigger and bigger, perhaps even upending the entire cable tv market and Netflix. I cancelled Netflix this week due to the Amazon Prime offerings...on the whole, this device is wildly impressive. A large clear HD screen, pretty high quality sound, and great amounts of content, from apps to music to tv shows to books...this is an entertainment system that fits into your hand!! Also, this week I used the camera at Malibu and the quality is amazing! The yellow on the flowers on the hills was stunning both in person and on the pictures I took with my Kindle. I was able to easily transfer the pictures to my laptop and was also able to email some of the pictures to a friend without any problem from my Kindle too. I never listen to music on my ipod anymore and listen to it on my Kindle. I also no longer play Solitaire on my iPod and play it on my Kindle instead. I am liking a lot of the applications for Kindle too, ranging from turning the screen into a playable keyboard to showing a map of the night's sky. So far, I am thoroughly pleased and even impressed, with my new Kindle. I like the touch screen, that is nice and most of the navigation of the Kindle is pretty straightforward once you get the hang of it.On the downside, I did not like and felt it was manipulative to make it so only music bought on Amazon could be easily put onto the Kindle, and that I had to download a special uploader which seems to have problems as well, giving a notice with every upload that it may not work...but was able, with some hassle, to get music from my computer onto the Kindle, but it should have been as easy as moving the files from the laptop to the Kindle but it was not. (You are supposed to be able to transfer the files easily but I was not able to get that to happen.) There was this weird third step of having to download their special app then having to upload your music from laptop to the loader then back to the Kindle. I would like to encourage to not be like Apple...I still, 3 years into owning my iPod, cannot figure out how to get music onto my iPod!! And it pisses me off. Still, the Kindle made it easier to get music onto my Kindle than iPod music uploads have been.The biggest complaint I have re this Kindle is the Silk browser is unstable and I really cannot use this Kindle for much in the way of web use. I can look at static pages, without interactivity. But almost none of the things I need to do can be done online using the Kindle. It seems to not allow you to look at pdfs and even tho I downloaded an app from Adobe to read pdfs they still are not being read...I do a lot of research on ProQuest for instance, and I cannot see any of the articles using the Silk browser. Additionally, it does not seem to work with Flash!! I cannot play any games on Lumosity, for instance, on the Kindle due to some kind of Flash issue and when I tried to find an app to fix this, I could not find it. With no ability to see pdfs or Flash websites, or no way that is obvious to me (and I am in a graduate level tech/design degree program, so I am no idiot when it comes to tech), it severely limits the utility of this device as it applies to the web. Also, the Silk browser freezes up constantly. It needs to be improved. I would have preferred a more stable browser such as Firefox. Almost every time I go online to any site other than Amazon's stores, it freezes and when I do get to websites, they are very limited when the pdfs and flash do not work. It is also unclear whether we are charged money to transfer documents to this Kindle. I believe on my old Kindle they charged us if we sent documents to ourselves. I am unclear if I send documents to the email address of my Kindle HD if I pay for each upload and I wish they would make that clear somewhere. On the whole, though, I am wildly impressed with this Kindle. I really beg Amazon to avoid the pitfall of Apple of making things only work within the itunes store for the ipod making it nearly impossible to upload anything else to the device. I do not like the additional steps to upload my own music onto the Kindle and hope Amazon moves away from that type of thinking on its devices. I hate Apple and avoid their products due to the way they make them so incompatible with everything else. I resent it. I hope Amazon realizes this device has so much utility, enough for them to not have to play games re content. Let us upload our own content plus things we bought at Amazon, with equal ease.I highly recommend this device. It has enhanced my entire life for a month now. It has become my #1 music, movie, game center and favorite camera to boot! Not to mention my primary reading source. Great screen! Great sound! Great utility! Great job, Amazon!!
Reviews.Title: Truly worth the money, I use it more than my iPod and cancelled Netflix due to it, but the Silk Browser seems unstable

Reviews.Author: judy mulack
Reviews.Content: I got the 8.9 kindle fire HD as an early birthday present to myself.  Overall, the experience has been good.  When I first received it, the silk browser would not load.  It kept saying that there was a fatal flaw and that the browser needed to be restarted.  The only problem is that every time I restarted it, it gave me the same error.  This is detrimental to the kindle overall, but it is not a problem for me.  I simply side-loaded Dolphin (my preferred mobile browser) onto my kindle.  As a lover of the original kindle fire, I was pleased with the changes I found on the new HD.> The sound, for a tablet, is outstanding.  True, it is not booming, but it is true stereo sound which is pretty impressive for a tablet.> The HD is beautiful, but that was not the greatest selling point of the screen for me.  With my first generation kindle fire, going outside was out unless I could find a shady spot or if it was really cloudy.  I *LOVE* the anti-glare screen incorporated into the new HD.  I can sit outside in direct sunlight and still see my screen.  This is a great thing!>The "ads" that show up on the lock screen are no big deal.  I just do not pay them any mind when I turn my kindle on.  I do have to say that, even though a lot of people seem to complain about the recommendations offered on the home screen, I actually find myself scrolling through them.  They show you games/apps/books that you may like based on the app/book that is front and center on the home screen.  I do not worry about my kids or myself accidentally purchasing, that is what my password lock is for.>My favorite pre-installed app on this new device is Freetime.  I wish that I could download it on my first generation (I have two kids).  For $3 a month my kids have unlimited access to children's videos, games, apps, and books!  The videos need a wifi connection, but once they access/download an app or book onto the device it is there in the freetime app.  This was a great little discovery when I was stuck at the doctor's office with my toddler a few days ago.  There are literally HUNDREDS of choices for them.>I also really appreciate the fact that I am no longer allocated a miniscule amount of space for apps.  My kindle comes with 13 Gb's of free space, and if I want to allocate all 13 gigs to apps and games, that is my prerogative. It drove me nuts that I was only allowed 1.17 gigs of space out of 6.5 gigs of free space for apps on my first generation.>I **DO NOT** like the placement of the USB port for charging.  The reason is that I like to say in bed and watch movies while going to sleep at night.  I can not use the case to prop the kindle up in landscape mode and charge the kindle at the same time.  I like the placement of the USB port on the first generation much better.  This one little thorn in my side is the main reason that I am only giving this product four stars.>I played with the camera a little bit.  I was not really impressed with it.  I do like how it uses the screen as a flash, but the pictures always seem to come out grainy.  I thought that it was supposed to be an HD camera.  Hey, and how about a video camera option??  This also helped contribute to this product losing one star in my review.This is all.  Overall, I am very pleased with my purchase.  I recommend this product.  It is great for the price (I got it for $269 the week before Valentine's).
Reviews.Title: A very good product with a few flaws

Reviews.Author: Ashley G
Reviews.Content: I cannot put it down. If your wifi is fast, you will have a great experience. There are a ton of kids apps and games as well as a great selection of movies, tv shows, and books. I would suggest that you don't buy the charger that they say comes with it if you have a smart phone charger that you can switch usb cords with. It works just as well and saves you $20. The Fire is very simple to use and a great deal.
Reviews.Title: Love it!

Reviews.Author: Kristen A Prossen
Reviews.Content: I love this new tablet.  It has performed exactly as it was listed to and is so light and easy to manage.  Best investment I've made in a year.
Reviews.Title: Everything I Expected

Reviews.Author: Adeptus Astartes Mechanicus
Reviews.Content: I use it everyday, at least twice a day. I had the old 7" kindle fire. This is SO much better. Magazines don't need to be zoomed, though I still will, but the higher res and slightly large screen is so much nicer.
Reviews.Title: Best tech gizmo I have

Reviews.Author: jdcoto
Reviews.Content: My Kindle is GREAT!! I love it sooooo much. It has been such a pleasure to play with and it was my birthday present. My hubby gets an A+ on this one!!
Reviews.Title: LOVED IT!!!!

Reviews.Author: cjmanning86
Reviews.Content: As the title suggests... I have just received my Kindle Fire 8.9" HD (without 4G) a couple hours ago!  I work in the IT and Data Management fields, love electronics and many devices.  I will be able to honestly and thoroughly review this product for those of you out there still looking to buy one or be informed.Packaging -  The packaging used to hold my Kindle Fire was typical Amazon style.  It came in it's own 'Kindle' box with the manifest attached.  While I worry about this, I can say my device is without defect and it seems their box is more protective than it seems.  I also must say I like that they use recycled material that is also further recyclable... very 'green' of them and it's appreciated from a passive standpoint.Directions -  I must say this is splitting hairs a little... but I am dissappointed that they don't provide at least some basic instructions as to whether you can start charging it right out of the box or not.  I assume that the battery needs to be fully charged and then fully used until it dies and then fully charged again to charge all possible cells thoroughly?  I know some phones were like this, and still are in some cases with other devices too.  Right now I'm trying to charge it and then after that I will see what the battery life is initially and report it, and then charge fully after death and then see what it is after a complete recharge and report it too :)Accessories -  I don't know if most people order accessories right off the bat or not, but I made sure to buy a good screen protector and leather folio/bluetooth keyboard case for mine.  I recommend Tech Armor's Lifetime warrantied HD screen protectors.  Since the Kindle Fire HD already has anti glare built into it's glass, no need for matte types of screen protectors.  Matte types take away from the crispness of the HD screen anyways.  I also recommend MoKo's Bluetooth Keyboard Case... it is of great quality, and after tons of research of the other brands, this one had the reviews that made me feel safest with the stitching, compatibleness with ALL of the function buttons, and charging time and more.  Other than that, it's up to you... but I'd say these two are a must!  Check them out!Feel and Initial Reactions -  This device is heavier than I expected, but that is no complaint!  It feels natural, almost like it is in that sweet spot for a device to not be too heavy and not too light.  I was actually worried of dropping it because it's not as grippy as one would think or expect either, and I didn't want to touch the screen until my protector was on it either!  It is just the right size though, and fits in your hand well.  It's very thin, cool to the touch, and it's display is absolutely marvelous!  The colors are deep and sharp, but not too bright.  THe brightness is sensitive I will say, with half way down being almost unreadable in any indoor lighting.  I am making use of the auto brightness to help save battery while keeping proper reading brightness readily set.  It's also responsive, easy to use.  The on screen keyboard and feel to manipulate the OS takes a few seconds to get used to, but that's to be expected as I have only iphones in my house, and the first generation Kindle Fire which is sluggish and drull compared to this one.  The advertisements aren't that bad... honestly, who cares?  I'm sure there's an easy way my IT mind could find to take those out, but I did save money with them being there so I'll prolly leave them there for now.Features -  With everything making an attempt to be separate, but all be synced together at the same time... it's no surprise to see Facebook and Twitter instantly be found on this device upon setup.  Especially since I have both accounts and have shared items on the webpage with them (Amazon.com).  The dual WiFi antenna and dualbands make it really speedy compared to my iphone 4S's wifi speeds, and even here at work where our mobile network gets bogged down... it's almost expecting too much out of itself in regards to the warning I got that the network is slow and that I should update in the background upon setup (haha, it actually finished fast... it's too hard on itself!).Overall -  I am very pleased and I cannot wait to keep you all updated with my further review updates!  I love the service of Amazon.com, I love their products, and I love the features they offer with their devices.  I know I sound like a fanboy, but I am not often completely pleased like this (as I always find something that could be better)... and I assure you, I may just yet still find something on this tablet.  Stay tuned and find out!
Reviews.Title: Just Arrived... SO EXCITED!  (Will update as time passes!)

Reviews.Author: Mr. Ed
Reviews.Content: Sound is not really loud enough, I wish the on/off and volume buttons had a little colored dot on the face so they would be easier to find without feeling around for them.I found every app I needed for FREE in the store.Purchased it mainly for watching movies and reading books, for those two it gets the 5 stars.
Reviews.Title: I love my Kindle Fire 8.9 HD except for a couple really picky things

Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: The 8.9 in is great! The screen size for streaming is awesome! I also love it for apps like Pinterest (can see projects so much easier!) and to look up online patterns for crochet and knitting.  So glad we got it!
Reviews.Title: Totally worth the extra money for the bigger screen

Reviews.Author: MsVonnie
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying.. I deprived myself of a Kindle Fire for a year.. NOW the wait is over..I have to say this AWESOME..the Grapics are incredible... the Audio is AWESOME....I absolutely love the graphics. I have the 8.9" and I thought it would be too big and ackward for me to handle but its Perfect! I take it everywhere and discover new things I can do with everyday..Its a great machine, slender. lightweight. fits in most of our tote bags ladies! I am very pleased with.. was reluctant over the price but so glad I got it... My kids love it too. The Kindle free time makes reading more fun for them.Thanks Amazon!
Reviews.Title: I Love my Kindle Fire HD

Reviews.Author: David Harwood
Reviews.Content: It is easy to use. I like how it connects to the internet quick.  I also like how easy it is to trasnport.
Reviews.Title: I love my kindle!

Reviews.Author: Nicolette
Reviews.Content: I purchased my kindle fire 8.9 just after Christmas I knew I wanted a tablet that I could use on the go and that would fit in my bag I was torn between the Ipad mini and the kindle fire I had used a great deal of ipads but had no experiences with kindles then the kids I nanny for received Kindle 7" s for Christmas and after playing around with theirs I decided to go with the Kindle fire not even knowing they made an 8.9" screen and so far I am glad I went with the bigger screen, I have read books on it streamed netfix even downloaded some games for the kids and so far I am very pleased. The only thing I would change to far is if on the kids we where able to control the volume in the parental controls  (hint hint amazon) we are  able  to control everything else in the parental controls  and the "kindle free time" is excellent but the two of them compete over volume and before we know it they have them up the full volume and it is all you can hear! Another plus is I would rather deal with the amazon android market any day over dealing with Itunes!
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 8.9

Reviews.Author: Eric R. Maki
Reviews.Content: I've tried the 7" devices and the 10+" devices and this is the sweet spot. The hi-res graphics makes watching movies or Netflix comfortable, but your hands don't get tired with the added weight of the full size devices. I'm glad I spent the extra $100 for the 8.9!
Reviews.Title: Fantastic Device

Reviews.Author: Pelicanpat
Reviews.Content: Excellent tablet, HD is great, sound is great and there are so many things you can do on this! Keeps me quite busy!!!! Would recomend to everyone!
Reviews.Title: Will never regret purchasing this

Reviews.Author: Stanley Ruff "Transbug"
Reviews.Content: It worked just as advertised.  I bought this for my wife although she has the original Kindle.  She is completely satisfied.  I believe, however, opening it up to "all" android apps would make it better.  Right now it limits you to a small selection of which the better ones requires purchasing.
Reviews.Title: The Display is Awesome

Reviews.Author: Shawna F.
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my husband for Christmas and he loves it! He's on it everyday so we definitely got our money's worth. He can take it to work and watch movies or play games on his lunch break. It's also very convenient to take to church service on Sunday's and utilize the Bible app to look up verses. Not only does he really enjoy this Kindle, but my 3 year old daughter loves it too. She plays educational games which are helping her become more accustomed to technology. I chose the HD 8.9 because it appeared to be the best-now I can't compare it to any others because it's our first tablet but I say that it's pretty awesome! I think I will buy another one soon.
Reviews.Title: We Love it!

Reviews.Author: Dennis Chinea
Reviews.Content: whats not to like  all of the same or better features w a bigger screen and not so much money  I have not got the handle on working the web great yet - have to download some things before i can view but I think its just me learning to use the darn thing better  love it and use it every day!
Reviews.Title: big boy kindle!

Reviews.Author: Robert  Hanson
Reviews.Content: Use my device almost everywhere I go, have not see any low speed or drop connection when using my Kindle Fire, whether I'm using it for internet browsers search or watch a movie from the cloud.My Kindle is a Kindle Fire HD 8.9, Dual-band Wi-Fi, with 32Gbit internal memory.  I did not select the 4LG, thinking that I would try using (in the future AT&T; cell phone) for a hot spot and connect to it for Wi-Fi if I can't find any Wi-Fi to connect with.  I did op for the higher internal memory 32Gbit over the 16Gbit, I believe Amazon does make suggestion when looking to purchase this unit for streaming movies or if you are  going run lots games apps.  If you are use-to any of the Kindle e-readers, I would suggest buying their higher Kindle fire HD battier charger VS using the e-reader charger.  I'm currently using the e-reader charger on my Kindle Fire HD, but it does take up to 4 to 5 hours to completely charge the battier when dead or close to being dead.
Reviews.Title: Great wifi connection, so far not observed any issue connecting on any public wifi

Reviews.Author: R. Blough "Rick Blough"
Reviews.Content: This product can not be beat for the price. It does everything I have come to expect plus some. Purchasing and reading books with the Kindle is the original reason I purchased this item. Playing with it now for a few weeks I have found other neat features that will have me using it more often. Absolutely love it.
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9 - Highly Recommend

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I already had a Kindle reader before I decided to purchase the Kindle Fire 8.9 and I love it, but after much thought I decided to try the large and more multi-featured tablet.........best decision I ever made.  I read books on it, I keep up with my work calendar, check all my many email accounts and handle paperwork from my office and my students and my newphew plays games...... it's a win win for everyone.  I am still learning how to use all the features available, but over all, I would recommend this product to anyone for both pleasure and business use.
Reviews.Title: Awesome piece of Equipment!!!!

Reviews.Author: Dance of Life
Reviews.Content: This gift was purchased for my daughter. Her expression on X-Mas says it all. A great gift - she uses it daily. It was securely packaged in a nice box and in great condition.
Reviews.Title: Gift

Reviews.Author: Mels23
Reviews.Content: Many wonder (including myself) if I work for Amazon...I can't say enough great things.  I adore this product, I've purchased two (initially for my 5 & 6 year olds) and everyone in the house uses it.  I have an IPad, but, I use the Kindle whenever my sons aren't.  I don't want to get started on Kindle Freetime I'll run out of characters.  The best thing since the creation of Apps.  My little ones have a pletera of books/videos/learning games/games at their disposal.  The books are interactive, on their level, I'll probably never (or rarely) purchase a hardback book for them.  It surely promotes reading...to say the least.  It was also very easy to add music and music videos to their devices per the Amazon Cloud and/or connecting the kindle to my computer via USB.  Almost impossible with apple without purchasing via ITunes. Did I say I Love the Kindle Fire HD?
Reviews.Title: Exceeded Expectations

Reviews.Author: M. Price "The Divine Miss M"
Reviews.Content: My Kindle Fire HD was my Christmas present to myself and it is my favorite thing.  I can't imagine life before it.
Reviews.Title: My Favorite Thing

Reviews.Author: 5 STAR....Great fun!...
Reviews.Content: This is my third kindle and they just get better and better with each upgrade.  Wish they had external memory increase option.
Reviews.Title: kindle junkie

Reviews.Author: Hang'in with Daddo
Reviews.Content: This device is simply awesome! I went through 3 Asus TF700T's that had screen issues before giving this a try. The display is just as good if not better than the Asus TF700T, the audio quality is great (even compared to what I've seen with the Nexus 10), and the performance of the Kindle's dual core is comparable to the Asus' quad core.You also can't beat Amazon's customer service! I just wish Amazon wasn't so closed minded about allowing access to other, unmentioned, app stores. They would probably sell a lot more of these and the 7" models if they would. As long as they keep up their customer service and book/media services, or improved their app offerings, they would have nothing to worry about (yes, I realize you can side-load apps and can even go further if you wish).I'm VERY happy with this purchase!
Reviews.Title: Fantastic!

Reviews.Author: impalalady
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love my new Kindle Fire HD 8.9".  I bought the original Kindle Fire in November of 2011 and loved it.  My husband was constantly snagging it away from me when I got home from work because he likes the Solitaire game on it.  So, when the new Fire HD came out, I decided to get it for me and let him have the original Fire.  I read and search the web and play games, and I love the larger size. Now we both have a Fire and we both are quite happy!
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire Fan

Reviews.Author: Penny Verdigan
Reviews.Content: I HAVE USED THIS A LITTLE SINCE I RECIEVED IT AND LIKE IT VERY MUCH, I WOUILD RECOMMEND IT TO ANYONE WHO LIKES A MOBILE DEVICE OF THIS TYPE.
Reviews.Title: KINDLE FIRE HD 8.9

Reviews.Author: Trini
Reviews.Content: This kindle fire HD is amazing, the functionality is perfect,great sound, perfect viewing with 100% clarity. This tablet is really out of this world and the price is a plus.
Reviews.Title: Outstanding!!!!

Reviews.Author: Bella "Liset"
Reviews.Content: I received my new Kindle Fire today and I love it . I strongly recommend anyone to upgrade or purchase this kindle .
Reviews.Title: My New Kindle Fire HD 8.9

Reviews.Author: Michael Mikos "Capt Mike"
Reviews.Content: bought this for my wife as a christmas present.  she is addicted to it and uses it more than her ipad.  really likes the lightweight and at 8.9" it is the ideal size for her needs
Reviews.Title: much better than expected

Reviews.Author: dmcrane
Reviews.Content: my husband bought this for me for Christmas and he got the notice for 30 days of free prime for my 8.9 how does it apply to my system and thought I had seen special for prime for half price for year subscription but could not find when I set mine up :(
Reviews.Title: LOVE It BUT!!!!

Reviews.Author: James Stone
Reviews.Content: This tablet is awesome.  Was considering an I_Pad. But the camparisons made my choice to but the Fire.  We really enjoy this product...love it..we are glad we made the choice to buy the Kindle Fire HD 8.0"
Reviews.Title: Awesome Kindle Fire 8.9"

Reviews.Author: Karen Miller
Reviews.Content: Very happy with my purchase, and would recommend it for anyone who enjoys reading, but also wants access to the web, games, etc.!
Reviews.Title: Krazy for my Kindle

Reviews.Author: Keith R. Lancaster "mugglekeith"
Reviews.Content: I'd have to actually give it 4.75 starts b/c of the poorly placed and designed on/off switch, but close enough. This was a gift to my mother and it will serve her needs (FB, web browsing and reading) very well. The video display is sharp. Processing speed is better than average. The interface is good for someone that will only be needing a few uses from the device. Odd that the AC adapter was separate also. If you buy, be sure and pick one up.
Reviews.Title: Very Nice Product

Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: I love the Kindle Fire HD. The picture quality is the best along with the audio. I have owned it for two months and have not had any issues at all.
Reviews.Title: Awesome Tablet

Reviews.Author: LiahC
Reviews.Content: I ordered the Kindle Fire 8.9 HD on 11/18, (which amazon was currently out of stock of) I was told that my KF wouldn't be delivered until 12/6.
