I was cool with that, on 11/28 it arrived way EARLIER than expected. The packaging was nice, and snug. No dirt, not wet or anything. I couldn't wait to open it ... and when I did OH WOW ! The screen is fantastic, clear and very crisp. I have even used Netflix and Amazon Prime to watch movies/videos, and the sound is very loud & clear. It has the surround sound effect. I LOVE to read, and when I read, it feels like a real book. The web browser and everything else moves very quick and easy, I haven't experienced a lag of any kind yet! Sure, It didn't come with instructions, but in this day in age, everything you need to know about anything, can be found online. It is very user friendly and initial set-up took about 5mins. I am a previous owner of a blackberry, an android smart phone, and now I have a iPhone 4s, and a Macbook Which I love! (This is my first KF, btw) True enough, it did not come with a wall charger, I was about to be charged $19.99 for the charger, until I called amazon and told them, about the promo I saw, and they immediately changed the price to $9.99. And my previous android charger, works just fine. So far so good! I have also bought a Malware Case, Screen Protector, 2-yr Protection plan and the wall charger. Which I all love, and haven't had any issues with. All together, with tax included I spent under $460 for everything. iPad is nice, I used one before, But I WILL NOT pay $200-$300 more for it. KF does/has the exact same thing, minus the two cameras, free engraving etc. I'm only giving it 4 stars, bc it doesn't have the Google Play store, I was fully aware that this device wouldn't be flash capable too. Overall, I really think the KF HD is a GREAT choice. I LOVE it ! Thanks amazon!
Reviews.Title: AWESOME Product, Satisfied Customer ! (:

Reviews.Author: Justmom
Reviews.Content: This is the first tablet we have ever owned and so far the whole family is getting good use out of it. Since this is our first, we can't compare it to others but price wise it seems to be a good middle of the road deal as compared to an ipad versus a generic android tablet. I was a little bummed when I read that it didn't support flash player, but there is a quick and easy fix to get around it. So don't be scared off by people who say you can't use adobe with the new kindle fire.This link helped me figure it out:http://www.amazon.com/forum/kindle/ref=cm_cd_t_rvt_np?_encoding=UTF8&cdForum;=Fx1D7SY3BVSESG&cdPage;=1&cdThread;=Tx20MHMNXG5N2FL#CustomerDiscussionsNewAlso, if you have kids the Freetime app is really neat. I love that it has a timer so you can limit how long they are using the tablet. You do have to pay for it after a free trial period, but so far it seems worth it.I only gave it four stars because the help section on the device isn't very helpful, so for a newbie, like my family, it was a little more trial and error with somethings.
Reviews.Title: Impressed so far

Reviews.Author: David J. Brumbaugh
Reviews.Content: I'm really enjoying my Kindle immensely and using the first one downstairs. The sound blows me away when it comes to music and movies.
Reviews.Title: This Will Blow you Away!!!

Reviews.Author: Teresa Bryant
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my husband and he has been very happy thus far. Just  takes time going thruogh the user guide finding out about many options available.
Reviews.Title: good product

Reviews.Author: gina5864
Reviews.Content: this is my third kindle, better than the other tablets, only problem couldn't get my promotional wireless from ATT  to work.
Reviews.Title: best tablet yet

Reviews.Author: mel
Reviews.Content: i love the ease of use, screen quality, app choices, deals on books with Prime. i wish the drawing apps were a little better. Other than that the space bar is tricky when typing.
Reviews.Title: love it

Reviews.Author: Patricia
Reviews.Content: This kindle HD it great, why spend more than  $600 $700 hundred dollars when you can have this kindle HD  it's very light very no like the IPAD 4.....I'm very happy with this table..
Reviews.Title: kindle HD 8.9 great

Reviews.Author: Luis Gussoni
Reviews.Content: great product, great features, USB is a plus, sound is decent, overall a very positive evaluation so far. Highly recommended.
Reviews.Title: exceeded expectations

Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: This kindle so easy to work.  L ended getting the 8.9 inch HD with 64 gigabits off memory.Love it.I would recommend this Kindle to everybody.
Reviews.Title: very lmpressed

Reviews.Author: Windhoundfan
Reviews.Content: Last year when I bought my basic Kindle I never thought I would like it better then reading from a regular book, but I loved it so much that this year I bought the Kindle Fire HD 8.9.  I've had it for approximately one month and my husband is joking about how it is 'glued' to me.  Literally, I find it hard to part with it!  I have all my music at hand with Amazon's cloud, all my books, and can easily view almost any movie I wish by accessing my Netflix, HBO, or Amazon accounts.  How nice to have your whole digital library travel with you!Although I almost bought the smaller 7 inch, I'm glad I decided on this one.  It seems like the perfect compromise between the larger Ipad and the smaller tablets. Its more weighty, but I can appreciate the extra screen space and think I would have been frustrated with a smaller one.  Its nicely thin, its battery life is decent, and I've had no bugs surface yet. Getting used to the interface was very intuitive.  I do have 'Special Offers' version and don't find the ads to be a problem.I am amazed at the sound that comes from this little device-  especially pleased with the way Dolby digital can immerse you with  sound seeming to surround you.  The picture is also super-clear and I've had no problem connecting to WiFi and getting a decent signal.  Movies run great and smoothly.  As to Apps, I've found some great ones that are keeping me way too busy, and although the selection may not be as great as the Ipad has available, I'm sure the market will improve, increase, and blossom.The reason I went with the Kindle Fire HD was the good reviews its been getting and the attractive price... but Amazon's good customer service that I've enjoyed over the years definitely was a big deciding factor.  This Kindle has so far been problem-free, but I did have a small sound issue that was my fault in not understanding the controls fully.  In the Kindle's help files it gave me a choice to have Customer service call me to resolve my issue.  No sooner did I click on that then my home phone rang with a polite & helpful Amazon customer service representative asking if I needed help!  I didn't think I could be more of a fan of Amazon's customer service, but now I think I worship at their feet!!Areas that could improve on this Kindle (Nothing is ever perfect, mind you!):1) sometimes I find the 'touch' controls to be too sensitive when I am scrolling- especially albums in the music section.  Wish there was more of a border/neutral area to swipe so that I'm not constantly opening albums when I just want to do a gentle scroll.2) Shopping is way too easy...(I don't expect they would even want to change this, LOL)3) Sound and on/off button IS sometimes hard to access easily, although having a cover that turns it on/off is a plus...4) Wish it was lighter in weight (as I want to carry it everywhere)  It fits nicely in my pocketbook, but it IS a weight to carry around after a while.I rarely write reviews, but had to this time because I love this little device so!  Its one of the best Christmas presents I've bought myself!
Reviews.Title: Absolutely LOVE it!

Reviews.Author: KJ
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my wife's birthday. She loves it. The screen is bright, clear and the sound is great. My wife is very pleased and so am I!
Reviews.Title: Great Gift

Reviews.Author: fathobbit
Reviews.Content: This is my second Kindle.  I received it on November 26th.  The 8.9 HD 4G LTE.  The lack of a charger was nothing to be concerned with as most are now universal anyway. Out of the box was a little frustrating as the first thing it does is a large download as an update.  Just seems like Amazon could have done that on their data usage instead of mine.  I do absolutely love the screen it is amazing.  I love the Swype feature, it makes reviews a breeze.  I have had a little time to get to know it better now and am so very curious WHY Kindle felt the need to do away with the bookmark feature or I should say revise the bookmark feature. The old Kindle would go back to any previous bookmark made in the book, the new one only allows for the most recent bookmark, VERY annoying as I sometimes like to go back to a previous spot to recheck my memory of a person or event. Why would kindle feel the need  to fix something that wasn't broken. For that one very annoying thing I would have given it 5 incredibly awesome stars. Still the absolute best devise out there for the money!!I found the bookmark...instead of looking under bookmark look under"note" and VIOLA notes and bookmarks pop up....oh my I would feel like an idiot except notes are NOT what I was looking for...ENJOY your NEW Kindle!!!!
Reviews.Title: I  almost totally LOVE it!  ADDENDUM:

Reviews.Author: Deanne
Reviews.Content: Awesome love my new kindle HD. Gave daughter the old one. My sister bought the new one also for bigger screen. Great colors
Reviews.Title: Kindle

Reviews.Author: Into the Past "PDW"
Reviews.Content: I started with the first Kindle. I love to read and hear music. This one does it all and is transportable. Fits in my purse with a case. I have a wifi and the $49.00 per year program keeps me online. Easy to learn and operate.
Reviews.Title: WOW

Reviews.Author: Terri Berry
Reviews.Content: I've been very pleased with my Kindle Fire so far. The picture quality is excellent. My two year old grandson steels it from me all of the time to watch his children's shows on it. I also love that is so easy to shop from the Amazon web site from it. I would recommend the Kindle Fire HD to anyone looking for a simple, inexpensive tablet.
Reviews.Title: Great tablet

Reviews.Author: Lostie4ever
Reviews.Content: I have had a 1st gen Ipad since it came out and loved it. I did not like the fact that being only roughly 4 yrs old Apple has decided not to support it anymore with ios updates. This will eventually make my apps worthless as some already were becoming because they required the newer ios.With that said, I decided to look into the Kindle Fire HD 32gb. What I discovered was that it did everything that I previously used my Ipad for. Sure the App store is more limited but the trade off for me anyway was getting a Prime membership so I could use the instant movies/TV shows, borrow a free book a month and upgraded shipping. I really like being able to stream shows while I ride my exercise bike and the Kindle does a fantastic job of that.The other consideration was the Kindle Fire HD has a way better price point. I just could not see spending so much money again for an Ipad that might one day in the near future not be supported again and become nothing but a paper weight.I'm impressed with the picture quality. Streaming works flawlessly. Apps work great. Speakers sound good and produce enough volume. Syncing your Kindle with new Apps or updates is easy and learning how to use it was simple and straight forward.Cons: Battery life seems short. I've improved it some by reducing the screen brightness. Charging is really slow. I am using a 5w charger. Maybe I'll give the 9w Amazon charger a try to see if that speeds it up a bit. 19.99 seems overpriced though.I do miss being able to customize my lock screen and other screens. Oh well, not really a big deal. I did not pay the 15.00 to remove the Ads. They really are not intrusive so I will save the money.Again, the App store being limited is a con. So you need to consider that and look over Amazon's App store to decide if you can live with that. I also think the App store needs more Apps that are made for Kindle Fire HD and not just Android phones. Hopefully it will continue to grow!Suggestion: If you are looking for a cover for your Kindle try the one Amazon makes. I just got mine and it is well made, slim and works well doing the auto on/off. You can also easily fold the cover back and it is still slim in your hands. For me, this was important because I read a lot of books and I did not want a bulky cover.Bottom line: I love my Kindle Fire HD 8.9! I have no regrets and highly recommend it for people who use a tablet similar to me.
Reviews.Title: Life after Ipad

Reviews.Author: MaxStryker77
Reviews.Content: This review is edited as of 8/23/13 with respect to the Silk browser, which was recently updated.  My experience with the updated Silk is much better.  It hasn't crashed once and it seems considerably faster.  Since I purchased the Kindle a few months ago, I have gotten more familiar with the web interface, but it still isn't as intuitive to use as those on my Android phone  or iPod browser. I changed my rating from 2 to 3 stars based on the updated Silk software. I would probably give it 3 1/2 stars as I really enjoy the tablet, but I only use it for a few things.  I don't use it for emails or web browsing as much as I would like since it's not completely user friendly, but at least it doesn't crash anymore.My original review follows:I bought a certified Kindle HD 8.9 with expectations that I would be using it primarily for watching movies and TV shows.  I should preface my critique by admitting that I'm a huge Amazon fan (and stockholder), and take a neutral stance when it comes to product reviews.  With that, I feel the Kindle HD 8.9 is a very flawed product, especially with respect to its software and interface.I have pretty much given up using the Silk web browser, as it freezes continually. My ipod touch and android phone work more reliably than the Kindle for browsing.  Further, it seems  Silk is much more invasive when it comes to tracking activities, e.g., "Individual Website Data" settings are difficult to view and clear.  I certainly would avoid doing any financial transactions with Silk (note: I'm not a tech head, so perhaps others may find an easy work-around, but Silk just "feels" less secure than surfing on Chrome or Safari).The screen and sound are top-notch, and while Amazon over-hypes the quality of sound, it is clear and amplifies more than other tablets. Hi-fidelity it is not, but that's appropriate given the size of the device.  The screen isn't as vibrant as an Apple screen, but it is ample for viewing almost everything.  For photographers viewing pictures, note that the Kindle screen doesn't have a neutral white balance.  Pics are sharp and vibrant, but color accuracy is off a bit- biased slightly to a green hue (on min, at least).Books looks great, but the device is a bit heavy (especially with a cover) for hand holding for any length of time.I requested a return on the item after experiencing stunningly bad web surfing, but begrudgingly decided to keep it due to the relative positive book and movie viewing experience.  Early May, Amazon said their web developers were working on fixing the issues with their Silk browser in the "next few weeks," but I haven't noticed any improvement as of 6/20/13.If I had a do-over, I think I would have chosen a Nexus, Samsung or Apple Mini, but given the reasonable refurbished price for the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 and its capable book and movie delivery, I'm semi-content for now.Last, the "Ad" version seems very user friendly - I don't find it annoying at all; in fact I hardly notice it, so I would delay spending an additional $15 to remove the ads when purchasing, and remove it later if you find it obtrusive.
Reviews.Title: Great for books; okay for movies; browser improved but just okay

Reviews.Author: SCRN soccer mom "soccer mom"
Reviews.Content: I originally ordered a refurbished Kindle Fire HD 8.9" wifi only and it was great but decided I really wanted to be able to use it anytime, anywhere.  I returned it with no hassle at all, and then ordered a refurbished one with the data package.  I love love love it.  I did not want an iPad and I do not care for iTunes.  (We have an iPad and 3 iPod touches).  I do most of my browsing etc through Amazon so it made perfect sense to go that route.  I have the Amazon Prime which is fantastic for instantly downloading music, videos, books, etc.  The Kindle Fire HD 8.9" has many features I haven't even used yet, but so far I am very excited and really, really enjoying it.  I saved a bundle by going with a refurbished one - it has the same warranty as a new one - and access to everything I need it for.  If you are looking for a user-friendly tablet that is a great price, seriously consider the Kindle Fire HD 8.9" with the data package.  Amazon does a great job of comparing this device vs. the iPad, and for me, this was not only the better deal, but also suits my needs perfectly.
Reviews.Title: Love my Refurbished Kindle Fire HD 8.9"  with data package

Reviews.Author: Grandma Zona "Grandma Zona"
Reviews.Content: I had a first generation Kindle (bought in the first couple of months it was out) and finally traded up to a Kindle Fire. It's easy to use and the backlight when reading isn't a problem. It is a little heavy, but works fine if it's propped on something. There has to be an available WiFi close by that you can log in to if you want to use the browser or download books. I must admit I got spoiled with the first gen one in being able to download books anywhere. The color is fantastic, and the brightness can be adjusted as necessary. I haven't needed to change the font size since the default works fine for me. Battery life is great - I mostly use it for reading right now - even using the browser. Recharging is easy once I figured out how to plug in the charger - there are two ports that look similar. I have had this for barely a month, so I'm still trying out stuff, but I would highly recommend it.
Reviews.Title: Love it!

Reviews.Author: Barbara Lynard
Reviews.Content: I'm in the "over 65" group so probably use my Kindle for different applications than the younger folks but I wouldn't be without it.  I not only read books on it I use many of the apps available for games, weather and news.  I've downloaded many recipes and cookbooks on it and it's handy to have with me in the kitchen when I need it.  We have a house at the beach and I take it there with me when we travel as it so much more convenient than dragging along my laptop.  I especially love to watch movies on it and the quality of both the picture and the sounds is amazing.  I actually have 2 Kindles...one of the older, smaller ones plus this new one so I can have one charging as I'm using the other one.The only complaints I have are for some of the buttons/functions.  I had a hard time seeing and finding the off/on button plus the volume button as they are recessed into the side of the Kindle plus being black the disappear for me.  I bought a case to use with my Kindle which makes it much easier to use as it turns on/off when I open and close the case plus the buttons are much easier to see on the case as it's a lighter color.I don't like the charge port being on the bottom of the unit as when I'm watching movies I like to keep it charging and the cord at the bottom gets in the way.  Would be much more practical being on the side like the older Kindle.Other than those little inconveniences I love the Kindle and it goes everywhere with me.  Recommend it to older, retired folks!
Reviews.Title: I love my new Kindle Fire HD 8.9" and take it everywhere! (for the over 65 group)

Reviews.Author: Book Glutton
Reviews.Content: I had an original Kindle Fire, Full Color 7" Multi-touch Display, Wi-Fi. I received it as a gift. I used it occasionally. I knew someone more interested in it than I was. Yet, I was not willing to give it up until I looked into this HD 8.9" model. I really liked what I saw. From the day it arrived, I have gone nowhere without it. It has become such an integral part of how I do things. It has been the tool I did not know I was looking for. It's like carrying a personal office manager, research library, on-the-go resource environs, all your leisure time beneficial stuff, an audio & visual entertainment center, and more. Bring your Microsoft Word and Excel work with you. For this, there is OfficeSuite Professional 7 and other apps. Let your Kindle become your "note-catcher!" Do even more with Evernote. What PDF files do you like to keep handy? "Send-to-Kindle" those articles, memos, and other snips that cross your desk each day to read later. No longer let them pile up on your desk. Be overwhelmed at how DejaOffice can synchronize and simplify your office, laptop, and home computer calendars, contacts, notes and tasks (I gave up working with Outlook.com). You too will love doing all you calendar work, etc. on Kindle. Do your email. Text! Let WeatherBug for Kindle Fire check the weather. Get your news. Watch the Markets. Organize your Spiritual Life. Carry meditations and other prayers, or services like iBreviary or subscribe to Divine Office - Liturgy of the Hours Audio & Text Catholic Christian Prayer. Read the Bible, it's easy and cheap: Bible: New American Bible, Revised Edition 2011 (never mind all the rest that you can read). Carry your scholarly resources. Enhance your office with the New Oxford American Dictionary. Read the Classics! Write! Read audiobooks. Carry plenty of them for trips. There's 32GB. Use Bluetooth to make use of this in your car, with your home stereo, your desktop, or with a great headset (my favorite, for years, has been the Plantronics Pulsar 590 Bluetooth Stereo Headset) -- you can even pair a full-size Bluetooth keyboard. Of course, there's the Web! And surprisingly, this is all done with WiFi and not a subscription to a 4G network. You can also have the convenience of having complete wireless access to your Kindle via WiFi File Explorer PRO.Surprisingly, this is what I have been doing with the Kindle Fire HD 8.9" Tablet in less than 4 weeks and it feels like I'm just getting started. It really is a "Game Changer!" Like me, you may not know what that means to you until you have one!
Reviews.Title: "Game Changer!"

Reviews.Author: John A. Kuczma "RogueUlfric"
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD 8.9" is a comfortable mini-tablet sized e-reader with beautiful resolution and vibrant color.  It is easy on the eyes and displays even color text and photos flawlessly.  However, beyond that, it is a disaster.The means of navigating through a given book is slow and inexact, causing significant delays and frustration in finding any particular location in a publication.  Further, the only options for listing the books on the Fire 8.9 are full color mini-covers of each book or a somewhat smaller 'list' format that displays the books in small horizontal bars with an image of the front cover and a text description of title and author.  In either case, it is necessary to physically scroll through the titles (which are arranged alphabetically) to find any specific book.Once a book has been located, navigating within the book is equally slow and frustrating.  One must basically use a tedious scrolling through each individual page by pulling a finger across the screen either from right to left or left to right dependent on which direction in the book one is moving.Further, there is no reasonable means of grouping books, as was available on the DX, either by category or author.  It is equally difficult to delete a book that one no longer wishes to maintain on the Fire 8.9.With some major revisions, this may one day be a superior electronic reader.  At the moment, however, it has a very, very long way to go.
Reviews.Title: Visually impressive, in all other aspects markedly inferior to the Kindle DX

Reviews.Author: L. Horner
Reviews.Content: Although I'm new to the tablet world, I did a lot of research before purchasing the Kindle Fire 8.9 with 32G. I haven't been disappointed.  The picture is great, the sound is spectacular, and as I learn how to use it better I'm sure that new worlds will open up.  This is one Senior that embraces this new and wonderful technology.
Reviews.Title: New to the tablet world.

Reviews.Author: Marilyn Martyna
Reviews.Content: My kids bought the Kindle Fire HD for me for Mother's Day. I love it! I was surprised how much heavier it is than my regular Kindle, will take some getting used to.
Reviews.Title: love it!

Reviews.Author: MIKE
Reviews.Content: I bought my wife the K-Fire "7" for Christmas but my 5-year old son and my sister-in-law took it over! So my wife ask me to get the new K-Fire HD 8.9 an although she's only had it for a day or so she can't seem to put it down! Also the "QQ-Tech Removable Detachable Wireless Bluetooth ABS Keyboard PU Leather" case is very stylish and functional and a steal for the price!
Reviews.Title: KINDLE FIRE HD 8.9

Reviews.Author: Pat W. Brown
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my 80 year old cousin who loves to read.  She had been haivng trouble using a PC but is flying on the Kindle.  I'l kinda of jealous - think I'll get one for myself.
Reviews.Title: My 80 Year Cousin Loves It!

Reviews.Author: DNC
Reviews.Content: pros: "Everything" the wireless connection is great my router sets in the basement and I always get full bars.The sound is great two speakers are nice more than I can say for the third generation ipad I have the sound is much better than the Ipad and the wireless connection on my ipad has only one bar terrible connection compared with the Kindles.This is an Ipad killer for sure, I just put my Ipad on ebay I don't need it anymore I like the kindle 100 times better than the Ipad.Cons :My wife wants one now...
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9 can't be  beat

Reviews.Author: Barb
Reviews.Content: We love this for so many reasons.  The HD display is brilliant, making watching videos a very enjoyable experience. The web browsing is fast.  The variety of apps available is also outstanding, even more so if you are a Prime member. The Audio is just amazing. When shopping for a tablet, I sampled the audio in a store and was just blown away.  It is clear, crisp, accurate.  I enjoy rising early on weekends and reading the paper (which I now do on the Kindle Fire HD) with jazz playing in the background.  One morning, my wife heard me from another room, and she thought the music was coming from a different source--an outstanding, and expensive, high tech name brand stereo itself--and was just as blown away as I was that first time I heard how nice it sounds. The kicker for purchasing this over other tablets?  The price! I definitely recommend this!
Reviews.Title: Perfect for our needs

Reviews.Author: Croppled1
Reviews.Content: The multitude of reviews tell the story . Amazon designed the Fire HD to confine you to their system and limited storage to encourage subscribing to Amazon Prime for the cloud . You learn quickly any content there is lost if your subscription to prime lapses  . If your not open to that you more then likely should just buy a smart phone from Google ,  Microsoft's  Shadow RT , or at least a non modified Android entry .To say the makers of devices do not get along is a understatement . Google and Apple does not recognize the existence of the Kindle so you can't purchase from their ap store as a kindle owner nor are their conversion programs to convert them to useable . You can get around many of the shortcomings of the Kindle fire except for the lack of applications for which their is little motivation to write . Myself I believe the 7 inch model is the best deal as it is 1/3rd or less the price and you can use text to speech on books or increase the font size of print to solve the smaller screen size . Being able to just carry it on your belt or in a purse is priceless the 8.9 inch tablet really needs a 10.2 laptop case . I bought the one from case logic for $13 roughly and it fits the keyboard from Amazon basics perfectly  .You cannot upgrade the devices memory so buy as much as you can afford . I am so upset at myself for buying the 16gb model . It didn't take long to fill the memory up once you put on antivirus , some pictures , and video is a real resource hog . So far I have not learned how to add a flash drive . If I find a workaround for that I would be much more satisfied as I could free myself from the cloud . It was a nice find to use the Dolphin Browser for flash and Calibre on a desktop to download and rewrite books in the kindle format AZW3 .I hadn't read a book in years having bad eyes and suffering from severe chronic pain yet I took to it right away with the kindle . I wanted to use this while traveling but I now find my banks do not have applications that work with the kindle so it is merely a reader and video player limited to wifi though with Dolphin I can use the internet and purchase at most stores. I passed on the 4g since I saw how restrictive ATT was with a throttled data plan as well as expensive . Nothing short of the Sprint unlimited  plan would be acceptable for use . Someday someone will have satellite service you can plug in through the USB and I can't wait . Would be a great space for Hughs , Dish or even Garmin to enter . Would be nice if you could use a remote tuner just to access news and weather when off grid but so far I have not found a hint anything exists for that .So this is a nice machine but very limited and more for those who want to watch video where wifi exists and read lots of content of which not all is available for the machine  . Plan on using a small laptop bag or purse and not hanging this from your neck , or belt . Get ready to come up with endless work around's to become independent and if you use your device daily you will more then likely need to charge it nitely .That brings up another concern which is having to dock it to the micro usb port which are prone to wear out and or break contacts . I have had trouble since laptops were developed with charging connections on daily use machines . Paying cash to have them fixed is often 50% of the cost of the device . If the tech has changed you just scrap them .Well these are my thoughts outside what others have written or reinforcing issues previously discussed . Get ES Explorer , Dolphin ,Antivirus , Flash , plus Overdrive for library books with EPUB TO EWZ3 converter for kindle to read them with  Calibre for your desktop to download via usb and find free content . Take care will update after I have owned this for a while and learn more about work around's that are necessary and beneficial . I believe my next device will be a advanced smart phone with text to speech and banking abilities that works with Sprints unlimited data and access plans  . Very sad my institutions found designing apps for Amazons modified Kindle  OS not worthwhile but Google or Apple are covered . I wonder how the shadow rt devices will fair ? Though for those that use Fidelity Bank / Brokerage they do have a application that many speak very pleasantly about . That's a huge benefit for many who wish to use the tablet for day to day business when on the road and can control their fears over security at coffee shops , airports and other wifi hot spots away from home . Enjoy .Update : I think after trying the video content I can no longer complain about feeling like I am forced to join Amazon Prime . The truth is it is a great deal with the cloud . This device is sold very inexpensively and their is enough free content and applications available to keep one busy forever . This truly is a wonderful deal and is reintroducing me to reading on my terms . While wifi is not everywhere you can download content to view wherever you may be . My next mission to find a application that can download my newspapers while I sleep as it is docked charging . The possibilities are as endless as the kindle communities imagination . Oh and after trying Amazon Primes free video content I think I will cancel my Netflix . That will actually save me money and it is nice if you must stay at a hotel if they have wifi you can watch free amazon content . I opted to renew the prime though I do comparison shop before blindly committing to amazon for a purchase . It is hard to do but you have to be honest and figure in the cost of driving too and time for purchases elsewhere . The main problem is it is so easy to purchase items you do not organize your purchases as well as before since prime has no incentives to do so built in . I do like the add on items but wish it was easier to add something in as long as it hasn't shipped yet then delete then reorder taking a chance your previous item won't be sold to someone else or out of stock if you do . Still trying to learn how to print a document as well as write them on the Kindle . I think I need a class .
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD A Isolated  Red Headed Stepchild .

Reviews.Author: Induetime
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Kindle Fire when it was first released and was disappointed so I returned it.  When the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 became available, I decided to give the Fire another chance.  I'm happy that I did.  It is a great product.  I've encountered few, if any, problems.  The screen is as clear and sharp as any I've seen.  (I just installed my People magazine app and the magazine photos "pop" from the screen.)  The charger should have been included, as many have noted.  I bought the fast charge charger and it stopped working after a few charges.  Amazon shipped me a new one.  (Amazon customer service is great.  A lot of companies could learn from them.)  If you get the Kindle Fire HD 8.9, you should really get Amazon Prime.  The streaming is an amazing feature.  I don't know how they do it so well, but it's great.  And seeing an old favorite like "I Love Lucy" without cuts and commercials is a treat.  I don't regret, at all, my purchase of the Kindle Fire HD 8.9.
Reviews.Title: Even better than I'd hoped!

Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Denise"
Reviews.Content: This is my second fire, Initially I had the first kindle fire, which I now let my daughter use.  The only thing I can say about this that would begin to be negative is that I wish it had the back camera as well for taking photos with the device.  I also would like to be able to use a flash drive and put my documents on the device that way.  But this is a wonderful tablet.  I can print, read, watch movies, listen to music and so much more.  I would recommend this to anyone and everyone.  My daughter has her eyes on this device, but she will just have to wait awhile!
Reviews.Title: Love My Fire

Reviews.Author: Henry J
Reviews.Content: First off, the Kindle Fire is multimedia heaven. The screen is INSANELY high-res, with a pixel density just lower than that of the iPad's Retina display. The Dolby sound is no less than amazing. It's responsive, has low distortion, and is VERY loud. Don't buy a 60 inch plasma screen, huddle around this on movie night!The one thing that worries me is the camera. Amazon make you PAY to use it. However, ES File Manager allows you to access it without having to pay for something that should be included. (see below)DO NOT listen to the reviews saying "0MG T3RR18L3 T48L3T!!!1!" (OMG TERRIBLE TABLET!). This works well as an E-reader and a tablet. The Amazon Appstore is full of cool games for this and the other models of Kindle Fire.The storage can be HUGE. The 32GB model suits anyone nicely, as does the 16GB. It's actually very hard to fill.All in all, GREAT product.EDIT: I just noticed this review was posted on the 16GB, I have the 32. Oh well. I've used a 16GB anyways.EDIT EDIT: I'm going to hopefully replace my Fire HD with an HD X. This Fire is still going and works nicely, but I've noticed strange lag issues. It's rather old anyways and could stand to be replaced. NEVER FORGET! :PEDIT EDIT EDIT: The camera can be found in the Photos section, in one of the top corners.
Reviews.Title: A good tablet as well as E-reader

Reviews.Author: Todd McClintock
Reviews.Content: I went around and around looking,comparing, studying and fretting over which tablet to get. The best and obvious choice was the one I least expected. Since I already use Amazon for my mp3 s ,books etc. I went with the 8.9 kindle hd and purchased the Prime membership. I love it. watch movies, . play games, music email...I haven' t started my laptop since xmas!
Reviews.Title: Better than I expected

Reviews.Author: Susan Molander
Reviews.Content: I recommend this for everyone. Amazon has all of the extra's and it is well worth its price.....I recommend everyone buy one now
Reviews.Title: This is the best thing that I ever bought for myself

Reviews.Author: Emily Rivera
Reviews.Content: I have thoroughly enjoyed the kindle freetime app with my daughter, but recently came across a serious problem. She had swyped the top screen down and accessed the "exit freetime button." Then she touched the "reset to factory settings" link and then continued to do so. My daughter is three years old, so does not read and didn't know what she was doing. Yet, within seconds, she reset my kindle to factory settings erasing many important notes of mine and causing me additional hours of resetting up my apps and kindle for home and work.I would suggest that resetting to factory settings be password protected to prevent this from happening in the future. Freetime is a wonderful app and I would like her to continue using it without my supervision.
Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle, but parents beware!

Reviews.Author: Joanne "Joanne"
Reviews.Content: I own the original Kindle Fire and just purchased the Kindle Fire 8.9.  It is a fine tablet with excellent sound and graphics.  The internet on the Kindle Fire 8.9 seems to handle going in several levels deeper much better than the original fire.  It has audio ability on books set up for this option.I had problems setting up my uncommon email address on this tablet, but it was easily solved by using the K-9 email app found on the Amazon site.
Reviews.Title: excellent tablet

Reviews.Author: Sandra
Reviews.Content: this is wonderful. I am like a kid with this. except I am a grandma. Love my movies and the fact that I can get my old black and white movies and books,games, everything !!!!
Reviews.Title: I am lovin this

Reviews.Author: Mary C. Eustace "Lover of Oldies"
Reviews.Content: So far, the best ever. So much better than my first Kindle. Does so much more. It will be much easier to take with me when I go away. It was very easy to download my books from my other Kindle.
Reviews.Title: Loving my Kindle Fire HD 8.9"

Reviews.Author: Lisa Agee
Reviews.Content: Great product!  I love ordering from Amazon.com.  Very prompt and very easy to locate products.  Reccomend this sight all the time!
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire & Accessories

Reviews.Author: Donna Sisson
Reviews.Content: this is a christmas gift for my son i am glad to know it is durable and strong easy to use and it also has the kids feature on it so you can choosd how long they stay on there
Reviews.Title: great

Reviews.Author: R. Hamilton
Reviews.Content: I enjoy the larger display.  This is my third Kindle and have enjoyed them tremendously.  The larger screen and HD makes reading magizines easier to read.
Reviews.Title: Great Great Great

Reviews.Author: Swilli "Swilli"
Reviews.Content: Im sure no Pad is PERFECT! this is my first pad, it has a 1.5 ghz prosessor making it one of the Fastest pads on the planet! as i found, this thing is pretty darn fast! I Like the 8.9 kindle fire, i got a book allready started reading, i love how i can put it on talk and walk away and listen to the books!! that is awesome! also i love how it bookmarks and you can save certain sentences! this thing is aweeesommeee! of corse it is new so you might have to wait for a few apps like pogo and other certain apps but all in all i like it!! very nice little pad!
Reviews.Title: A few Flaws

Reviews.Author: J. Wegner
Reviews.Content: As a book reader this device is a 4 star.  It's not a 5 because my other two Kindles (an original and a recent model) display books just as well but they weigh a lot less and they don't rotate the image if I roll over in bed (yes, I know that the rotation can be locked.)As an Amazon movie viewer this is a 4.5 star.  The only weakness, as a personal movie viewer, is that the sound, although amazing for its size, is still a little weak in some cases. Maybe it deserves a 5 star but I may be feeling a little negative due to the other weaknesses.Then there is "Everything Else This Thing Is Supposed To Do."  Mostly 1 star.E-MAIL:  The built in capability for email handling is terrible.  I found an app which is workable for sending/receiving and since I'm fortunate enough to have a provider whose services include good sorting, folders, archiving, etc., that part is fixed.  However, wait until you try to "type" an email.  SWYPE is cool but gets really old, really fast.KEYBOARD:  Nah. The screen keyboard is for Twitter posts and IM -- not for anything remotely like notes, data entry, or anything that you might want to not have vanish when your finger accidentally brushes some spot on the screen.  Plus there is not workable copy/paste or search or any of the other rudimentary text handling features that have been around since the Apple II and DOS 1.1  And, the prompted-word/auto-correct feature is good for several years of Facebook jokes: "Look what he typed!"By adding a Belkin Blue Tooth keyboard there is a bit more utility (I'm using it to type this) but that still doesn't give you CTRL feature capability that you're used to with any real computer and the select/copy/paste type functions are still pretty kludgy.BROWSER:  Oh, my blessed Flying Spaghetti Monster!  What a piece of crap.  The browsers coming out of the various university backrooms in the 1980's were more fully featured and stable than this thing.  I've spent a good bit of time looking and cannot find one that will load and run on this HD 8.9.  Wow ... and I "used to" do a fair amount of Internet work.  How do you invest all of the time and money into something like this machine and then load something as brain damaged as this browser into it?SOFTWARE:  There is none.  Zero.  Nada.  Oh, "Apps"?  You mean those games or pieces of pseudo-software that are featured on Amazon and on the online store? (which quite often tells you that "Your device is not compatible.")  First, everything that I've looked at is (to be polite) "snoopware," which might not quite qualify as malicious spyware but you have no way of knowing.  Almost everything I've looked at wants you to permit the app's creator to have full access to all of your data, contact lists, history, etc.  Everything on your machine.  That'll happen ... not.Word processor?  Nope.  Spread sheet?  Nope.  All the app review areas are full of people commenting on them being snoopware AND, THIS IS IMPORTANT, almost all of them require that you be in a spot with WIFI access while using them.  Other reviewers complain that trying to create or manipulate files for use on office machines either does not happen easily or at all.Come on Amazon.  I don't give a dip about free or $14.99 apps.  I've paid hundreds of dollars for real software and would pay that much for an "office suite" of software to make this book reader into a really useful part of my life.For the Facebook users out there, don't bother trying to use the app that comes with the brain damaged browser.  You'll put a bullet through your new Kindle.  There are apps available which make the experience a little better but, compared to any regular computer, it is still hard to live with.TOUCHSCREEN:  My touchscreen experience is fairly limited but this one seems to work as advertised.  The problem is ... to what end?  Selecting bits of screens or highlighting text is stupid with a touch screen. Gimme a mouse.  Zooming with finger tips?  Cute.  Not much better than with a mouse wheel.  Spinning the carousel?  Where's the utility vs., a desktop of icons?  Drilling through menus and lists?  I have to tap more than once, frequently.  I never ever had to click a mouse more than once to execute a selection.  Gimme a mouse, unless I'm standing up or on the go.  For my uses, that rarely happens.  Maybe I'm not part of the HD's target consumer base.OTHER STUFF:  Well, I didn't look at the specs well enough and had no idea that there is no provision for any type of direct data transfer, like an SD card slot.  Cripes, the little junk video cams from China have micro-SD slots.  They can't be that expensive. So, for us old fossils without blue tooth cameras and the latest of the latest phones, what are we supposed to use?  The USB slot?  Ssssslow.For something without a fan or a hard drive motor, the battery life sure isn't very impressive.  I get about 5-6 hours of simple online time -- NOT using intensive processor features.  My guess is that a streaming movie or heavy graphics game will eat it much faster.I guess I won't go on because there are so many other reviews that this may never be read by anyone.  Just close this out by saying that it's a nice Kindle but as a former netbook user, I wish I had my netbook back.Update September 2013:Well, I've given it well over 6 months now and none of my opinions above have changed.  If anything, I'm way more negative about touch screens than before.  I've become much more swype proficient and now use it for short twitter-length stuff but really think that swiping or thumb stabbing is stupid compared to keyboard use unless you're keyboard challenged and can't touch type.  Insofar as selections, edits, copy/paste and accurately moving around a computer environment, touchscreens are a cute novelty which has no place in serious work.  I guess if you've never worked a keyboard, keyboard shortcuts and a full featured cordless mouse then you might think a touch screen is pretty slick.  It is not.
Reviews.Title: Nice Kindle ... crappy "computer" / tablet

Reviews.Author: A. G.
Reviews.Content: Its got a nice screen, but its slow and clunky, web browsing is a pain, can put third party android apps but they don't always work well. Also got the 250Mb per month data plan from ATT, but that doesn't work very well either and teh 4G LTE service is flaky at best in my area. Hence, this Kindle is lying around gathering dust while I continue to use my 3 year old iPAD, which doesn't even have a data plan. Waste of my money on all fronts withis Kindle.
Reviews.Title: Slow and clunky

Reviews.Author: PeepToePrincess
Reviews.Content: First of all, I am a die hard Amazon fan. I have referred quite a few people to prime and convinced a few people that the kindle was the way to go for an awesome e-reader (I read outside a lot and the kindle can't be beat for that). So of course when I saw the student prime deal for $70 off the Kindle Fire 8.9" HD, I knew it was too good to pass up! I should point out that I have an iPhone 4 but I am in no way one of those people who thinks everything Apple is better just because it's Apple. Anyway, I setup my Kindle Fire and let it charge for a bit. Then I downloaded one app. I was hanging out with a couple of friends after work and during our discussion, I decided to search for something on the web...this was when I learned my "great deal" so great after all. I did one search using the laughable web app, silk. The app crashed multiple times, froze, and then I even got an auto reboot. I don't have anything on my Kindle yet and I can't even do a web search? Don't worry, I had my 3 year old iPhone to use. So there I was telling a group of people how excited I was about  my new Kindle Fire and they get to watch me put my frozen Kindle down to use my old iPhone to do a web search. On a lighter note, the ads aren't so bad...Update (9/11/13):  It's been a couple of weeks since I received my Kindle Fire HD 8.9" and well, it's ok.  I received an email today from Amazon regarding my review.  Basically, they responded to my horrible troubles with Silk by clearing the app data and then doing a device restart.  So, you're telling me that in order to get a brand new item to work properly, I should have cleared all of the app data and done a device restart when I received it (you know, brand new)?  Wow.  As far as the device goes, it's alright.  I have had some videos crash and it's not exactly the most user friendly (Sorry Amazon, you wanted to design something anti-Apple, and you did, but you neglected one of the most important things that people love about Apple (being really user-friendly)).  I don't hate the device like I did that first day, but I can't say I love it either.  I've updated my review from a 1 star to a 3 star because of this.
Reviews.Title: Day 1...I'm hoping I can write a redeeming update in the days to come.

Reviews.Author: JenSom
Reviews.Content: I went back and forth between this and an iPad. I finally chose the Kindle Fire HD 8.9" and I love it. I use it every day for something from reading books to watching movies. I even found an app to make it useful at work! I was originally concerned that I went with the Wi-Fi only version. However, now that Verizon has made it easier to use our phones as HotSpots that is a little less of an issue. Simply put I totally love this product and am glad I chose it.
Reviews.Title: Awesome

Reviews.Author: Jeff Rees
Reviews.Content: this is the 1st kindle I have ever owned. it is meeting all my expectations @ this time. im happy.
Reviews.Title: great

Reviews.Author: cathy Prosser "Cathy"
Reviews.Content: Even though I have the very first Kindle, when it finally died, Amazon was very helpful and offered several options after determining my kindle was really done.
Reviews.Title: Good experience

Reviews.Author: Kim T.
Reviews.Content: Patiently waited for a good deal and the time finally came to jump in and BUY!!  Easy to use, though re-furbished it looks new, works great, color good, fun to read books on, small enough to travel with, I could go on and on.  I'm pleased and love my beautiful Kindle.
Reviews.Title: I am SOOOOOO Happy With My Very First Kindle!!

Reviews.Author: Everett Blake
Reviews.Content: My experience with the silk browser has been frustrating. This is my second review of the Kindle and my complaint is the same as it was before, Silk browser not good. With the exception of the browser every thing about amazon, the Kindle, customer service, etc has been wonderful.  But after contacting amazon the first time and getting a replacement Kindle because my first one had a problem with the browser freezing or suddenly stop functioning, again I'm experiencing the same problem, browser suddenly shutting down and getting the message that the browser suddenly stopped do you want to restore your settings? I will not be recommending this product to anyone.
Reviews.Title: Silk browser not good!

Reviews.Author: A. Jane Smith
Reviews.Content: I love this tablet! Beautiful clear image and very fast. I would recommend to anyone looking for a personal tablet.
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9

Reviews.Author: Jenjen
Reviews.Content: Background info: This is my second kindle fire. I originally used the first gen for quite a while before "upgrading" to the HD 8.9. I am a working professional, but I primarily use this tablet for college textbooks.II was excited when I received this kindle as a gift in Nov. 2013. I spend hours each week reading through textbooks, highlighting, and taking notes. The larger screen was greatly appealing to me b/c I do not exactly have the best eye sight. Also, I would frequently take my old kindle to work to read whenever I had a break. Right off the bat I noticed some unfortunate drawbacks to this tablet:1. The battery life is abhorrent. My original kindle fire could last for days without requiring a charge. However with this tablet, I need to keep it on the charger whenever I am doing homework. I can still take my kindle to work to read, but there have been a number of occasions where I sat down to catch up on a chapter only to find my kindle at 3% battery life because I didn't leave it on the charger the night before. In other words, with this kindle you have to really remember to always leave it on the charger.2. The touch screen makes my life miserable. I can't tell you how many times I have sat here touching a word, zooming in, zooming out, having the screen freeze, restarting the kindle, and then beginning the process anew just in an attempt to highlight a sentence. I often feel like I would have been better off spending the extra money to purchase the actual textbooks rather than the kindle editions so I wouldn't spend 10 minutes trying to highlight two sentences. I also have trouble trying to get the home button to pop up. Rather than having the little home screen show up, I usually end up turning the page multiple times before actually getting the home icon to show up. For reference, I did purchase the amazon tablet stylus, so I am not trying to do all of this with my finger. I am using a stylus and still having issues.3. Advertisements. My original kindle fire did not force me to look at ads. This one does. I don't feel this is necessary. I'm not using my kindle to shop. I'm using it to study, so I do not need these kinds of distractions.The only pro that I have for this kindle is the screen size and resolution. It is nice in comparison to the original kindle fire. However screen response and battery life are complete poop. If you are looking to purchase this kindle for the sole purpose of just reading books from home, you are probably fine.If you are a student or professional who frequently reads on the go and/or utilizes the highlighting function, look into another kindle b/c this one is not the one for you.
Reviews.Title: Not great for college students, reading on the go

Reviews.Author: Lucinda
Reviews.Content: I bought my first Kindle 8.9 HD because I had read by its description, that it was much faster than the Kindle Fire. I was very disappointed to find after having it for a couple months, that it was slower than my old Kindle. It also would get hung up saying that the browser was not responding and this happens when I am using numerous different applications. I wanted to return it then but decided to give them a chance to fix the problem with no luck. I am now on my third replacement due to this being my only recourse since I have to have so many replacements before they will think about refunding my money.  They just won't say how many replacements I have to go through.  I have to delete my history every day, but I still have problems on the web search, on Facebook, during checking my mail, while playing games.  I want to go back to a plain Kindle Fire....IF only they could fix these problems.
Reviews.Title: Very Disappointed!

Reviews.Author: Dr. Michael Zhao "MZ"
Reviews.Content: I have iPad, Nexus, Galaxy, Asus. Kindle fire offers the best battery life of all tablets.I usually don't buy refurbish units, but I trust Amazon. What I got has no difference from new ones.Reason for not giving 5 stars is due to no access to Google Play Store.
Reviews.Title: Best battery life in tablets

Reviews.Author: Pb
Reviews.Content: I really like my new knindle fire hd 8.9, with rthe Dolby Audio-dueal band wi-fi, it works great, the thing that is missing for me is the dual camera, the single camera works fine, but, dual whould have been better
Reviews.Title: Happy

Reviews.Author: Dredriant
Reviews.Content: I haven't had any trouble with this refurb unit and if I did, Amazon makes it right so it's a worry-free purchase
Reviews.Title: Couldn't tell it wasn't brand new

Reviews.Author: Southern Girl
Reviews.Content: This device is a must for every book lover and as an added bonus meets all the needs of owning a tablet.  The video stream is clear with beautiful picture and excellent sound.  I take it everywhere I go (along with my Verizon hot-spot) so I'm never bored waiting for appointments, flying, or riding in a car on long trips.
Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle~

Reviews.Author: C. H. Wang
Reviews.Content: Acceptable price & good quality. Fast response with rapid browser performance. High C/P ratio and good customer experience...compared with old 7" tablets.
Reviews.Title: Good Machine

Reviews.Author: TexAZ
Reviews.Content: Overall I like my kindle but I am not sure I would buy another, mainly because it is so restrictive. The only browser available is the Silk which is OK but sometimes does not work with flash, some websites don't recognize it and will ask for Mozilla, Chrome or ie, and my bank website simply hangs when I try login.the display, sound and wifi are excellent, when checking signal strength from my router the most powerful signals are from the 2 kindles devices, the PC laptops and android phones are always low. it is also the first to connect after a router reboot.
Reviews.Title: A Tablet with some limitations

Reviews.Author: jan chilton
Reviews.Content: I HAVE A LOT OF PAIN SO SPEND A LOT OF TIME LAYING DOWN. I SPEND HRS ON MY KINDLE. WOULD BE LOST WITHOUT IT. TRULY WAS A LIFESAVER AND I CAN DO SO MUCH WITH IT. AMAZING
Reviews.Title: LOVE IT LOVE IT.

Reviews.Author: Pam
Reviews.Content: I have had a Kindle Fire for several years. I have loved it.  But for some reason it would no longer charge, when I called I was given several options, one of which was To buy a Kindle Fire HD 8.9. Bigger and better. right? Not so.  I was told it was a 16gb. Well at 12gb I was told I was out of space.  There is no light to tell you if it is charged.  Every day I have to reboot it for some reason or other.  It is slow. I use my phone more than this device.  I would like to send it back and am really thinking about it.  There just really are several things I don't care for on it.  It only has a front facing camera.  What good is that?  Would I recommend this product? No. I will say that Amazon has always been good to deal with.  I hope they will be on this.  I bought a cover for it. so I don't figure they will buy it back. oh well
Reviews.Title: Dissapointed

Reviews.Author: Colleen
Reviews.Content: I replaced my old tablet with a Kindle Fire HD and have been surprised how much easier it is to use and keep updated.  I am still learning the little tricks that are built into it that I did not expect.  I especially like the fact that it is supported by Amazon and is kept up to date with new apps, etc.  I was pleased to find the Zinio app so I could read my favorite magazine on my tablet.
Reviews.Title: I love it

Reviews.Author: Johnnie Michaels
Reviews.Content: This was a replacement for the kindle I had previously purchased (after almost flawless performance, the volume button stuck and none of my apps would work).  I was excited that Amazon replaced that kindle with a new one, however, the new one's performance has been very disappointing.  It stops in the middle of games and I have to shut it down and restart it several times a week.  On occasion, I will have to restart several times to get it to work.
Reviews.Title: Disappointing performance

Reviews.Author: Denise Mitchell
Reviews.Content: I never owned a portable tablet before and I am incredibly satisfied and very happy with my choice of the KindleFire. Now I know why everyone is gaga about them.Thank you
Reviews.Title: Perfect

Reviews.Author: W. Halberg
Reviews.Content: The size is good, the display is great, but it falls down in several areas. Charging time is very long and it loses charge rather rapidly, even when it is not being used. Its Wi-Fi reception is also poor at times. An older Kindle has no trouble at the same location. The Silk internet browser operates quite erratically; at times it just doesn't seem to connect. The e-mail program is quite good, however. Most other apps work well on it.I am now using the third Kindle Fire HD. The battery failed after six weeks on the first one. The replacement sent to me would not start up right out of the box. The third one seems to operate OK after several months. In general I have to say I am quite pleased with it but it could be better if it didn't have the problems indicated above.
Reviews.Title: It's good but could be better

Reviews.Author: Meredith Enny
Reviews.Content: Well, this isn't a terrible tablet, but it does have some very annoying issues. For instance, why do the manufacturers make it so easy to un-register the device. I let my 5 year old play with the Kindle because it offers some really cool apps for kids. What it doesn't offer is protection against those kids finding the button that un-registers your device.  My daughter found that button and all she had to do was tap it, effectively wiping my Kindle out of all apps, books, movies, etc. I had to download everything again and basically lost all of the saved data for all of my games. When you are on level 70 of Candy Crush, this can hurt. I did indeed put parental controls on the device. You have to put a password in to buy things, connect to wireless, etc., but hey, if you would like to erase all of Mommy's data just tap this button. Great.The charger still stinks! I plug the cable in to charge it and heaven forbid you move it the wrong way, it doesn't charge. The charger cable feels loose. That happened with my old Kindle as well. Yo would think that they would have worked that out by now. No, not so much.My Kindle likes to freeze up while playing some of the apps or surfing the net. I force it to shut down and reboot it. This has happened on many occasions.If they could only iron these issues out, I would have no problem giving it at least 4 stars.I'm very disappointed. It could have been great!
Reviews.Title: Would be great but has really annoying flaws!

Reviews.Author: Jason whitlock
Reviews.Content: really love this kindle, I bought it because my school is going to all e books. it is great for me being on the go all the time. the only downfall is that there are a few apps I needed for school and could not download to the kindle like coursesmart. I have to download my text book to my laptop and load it onto the kindle but for the price that is fine with me. I have bought two so far and considering getting my 7 year old on to help him with his reading. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a table/e reader now this is no I pad you cannot get every app you can on the I pad or android phone even thought it is android IOS they hide it really well. but kindle does have great apps and prime is the best I would do prime just for the shipping but it opens up your selection of free or really cheap books
Reviews.Title: great product

Reviews.Author: Gregory84
Reviews.Content: I'm sure there are better tablets out there but for the money and my needs this is perfect for me. I read on it and surf the web so i didn't need an IPAD or any other super expensive tablet. The amazon shop function is easy to use and i buy stuff all the time.
Reviews.Title: perfect tablet for me.

Reviews.Author: kraftyk
Reviews.Content: This tablet is very functional. The sound and picture are very clear and I'm able to do everything on this tablet and it's very fast and functional.
Reviews.Title: Great

Reviews.Author: Linda V. Ross
Reviews.Content: I love the kindle as a reader only. Books download easily. The problem is with the Silk browser. More times than not it stops working and the page freezes. Very frustrating. Would not buy again.
Reviews.Title: Silk browser

Reviews.Author: Win C.
Reviews.Content: I bought it for my grandson's sixth birthday present and he will not put it down. Besides the free games he has books on it that he can read. It does almost everything my iPad does.
Reviews.Title: Great birthday present!

Reviews.Author: John P. Bartlow "John"
Reviews.Content: Every few minutes Silk crashes. It's ok otherwise.Why do these silly things force you to type a minimum amount of words.
Reviews.Title: Silk browser crashes

Reviews.Author: We live near Illinois corn fields.
Reviews.Content: I can't believe how fast the battery runs out (especially compared to my Kindle Fire) and the time it takes to charge it is even worse. I wish I would've just bought another Fire.3/19/2014 I have had my this Kindle Fire 8.9 for three months now. I'm still so disappointed in its battery life. I do nothing any different on this Kindle than I did on my Kindle Fire (now two years old) but the battery drains so fast. What is worse is when the battery gets down to 10% and it is plugged in it shuts itself off. It WON'T EVEN WORK WHEN PLUGGED IN and the battery is low. I charge it for 8 hours to get 30% battery-that is when it has been turned off the entire time.HATE THIS KINDLE FIRE 8.9. Wish I would have just stuck with my Kindle Fire and bought a new case. Ugh! :(
Reviews.Title: Big disappointment compared to Kindle Fire HD-updated 3 months later

Reviews.Author: Joseph Collomy
Reviews.Content: I bought this Kindle wanting to be able to dodge having to carry a load of books around and perhaps even avoid games on my phone which sucks up battery life. Best purchase I could have ever imagined. Not only can I adjust font size and line spacing with this product, but I can still enjoy streaming content, games, and more on the go with amazing battery life! My phone can stream up to four "hour" long episodes of my shows, while the kindle unplugged on 90% brightness streamed eight episodes before hitting 15% battery. I would strongly suggest the kindle over any tablet as it also allows you to side load android apps not available in the Amazon App Store. Amazon made an extremely smart choice by allowing their users to have that freedom. Do not hesitate, buy it now!
Reviews.Title: My smartphone is jealous.

Reviews.Author: Mary V. Seneker "newly retired READER!!!"
Reviews.Content: I love my 7" kindle Fire, too,but I'm getting really hooked on this one.  Easier to read with a bigger screen, and easier to do just about anything!  LOVE it!
Reviews.Title: it's BIGGER!

Reviews.Author: Sharon Z.
Reviews.Content: Loved the kindle, but then it wouldn't recharge.  Did not read warranty link "1 year warranty from original purchase".  So I called Amazon.  They had me reset and try to charge.  They were going to call me back in 30 minutes but didn't call for 6 hours.  Was driving and they told me I could buy a new Kindle...  Was not a happy camper.  Just purchased a new battery and am planning to install next week.
Reviews.Title: Warehouse Deals must just resell returned items rather than repair

Reviews.Author: H. Toliver "co-author"
Reviews.Content: I can't compare the Kindle Fire with other tablets, but having a previous Kindle and having made purchases of books and music from Amazon over the years, I was pleased to find these readily available.  They wouldn't have been of course with another brand of tablet.  I bundled the Kindle with a stylus, headphones, and a carrying case that props up for viewing.  These enhancements make both listening and reading easy and convenient.  The sound quality for classical and folk recordings is excellent.  I happen to have heard several of the folk singers in person and noticed that in other replay systems something is always lost, both from the voices and the instrumentation.  With modestly priced earphones, not so on the Kindle.  The back lighting makes reading about the same as having a book in hand or a little sharper.  It is easy to bookmark passages and return to them though not to cite them by original page reference.  I usually use a computer for internet searches, but the Kindle serves all right for that and keeps track of website history.  It doesn't of course have all the tools of a good browser.  All told, I'm very satisfied after about 6 months
Reviews.Title: bonuses in the package

Reviews.Author: Roxann Gaghich
Reviews.Content: I have ordered one Kindle and four Kindle Fires in the last five years.  This is the first one that does not come with a wall power adapter.  It is sold separately for $19.99.  No where could I find that this was not included.  When informed by Amazon that this is the case, I went back to the description.  You have to go to the very bottom (about five pages), where you are told this.  I think this is a  deceitful practice.  Also, this Kindle does not show a power light when it is charging (previous models have).  I will try this Kindle over the next few days, however I may not keep it.
Reviews.Title: No Power Adapter Cord?

Reviews.Author: taur125
Reviews.Content: I bought the Fire HD 7" when it first came out.  It has been very reliable, and I decided to get the larger Fire HD 8.9".  I use the HD 7" mostly as an ereader, but the larger 8.9" screen is great for watching movies, playing games, and using the internet.  It is quick to load pages on the internet, has fantastic resolution, and is very easy to navigate. Since this Fire has been out for a while, it seems to be very polished and without any bugs.
Reviews.Title: Very Pleased

Reviews.Author: Kindle user "Kindle User"
Reviews.Content: It is a very good tablet however the main draw back I am finding is the battery life is not very long when compared to the 1st gen I had. But all in all a good machine.
Reviews.Title: Refurbished Kindel Fire

Reviews.Author: Judy Hughes
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire HD 8.9", and wouldn't give it up for any other device.  I have looked at other readers and tablets, and the Kindle does everything that they do, but better.  I am so happy that my husband bought me my first Kindle a few years ago, and each year has upgraded for me.  Thank you Amazon for making such a great product, and I look forward to my next Kindle in the near future.
Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle

Reviews.Author: steven "steven"
Reviews.Content: its greatits all it said it wasit does alot and you can get anything on itits fast than my sister inlaws apple ipadthe price i paid was $229.00 but two days after i order it .it went down to $189.00 thats a $39.00 mark down
Reviews.Title: its great

Reviews.Author: Shirley Joan cobb
Reviews.Content: NOT TO SURE ABOUT MY PURCHASE HAVE HAD PROBLEMS WITH IT FREEZING UP AND TROUBLE GETTING ON THE INTERNET.  WORKED FOR OVER AN HOUR WITH HELP BUT PROBLEMS CAME BACK AND CAN NOT SEEM TO USE THE INTERNET AND THAT TAKES AWAY ALOT OF THE BENEFITS.  STILL WORKING ON PROBLEMS WHEN TIME IS AVAILABLE.
Reviews.Title: KINDLE FIRE HD 8.9"

Reviews.Author: rose
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with tablet with new battery that didn't last 2 hour's in last tablet.. Thanks for fast response to problem. Very pleased with customer service providers.
Reviews.Title: kindle fire hd 8.9" 4g lte , 64 gb

Reviews.Author: Adrienne M. Brown
Reviews.Content: i use my tablet all the time. it is easy to use and does everything i wanted. i don't even need a lap top now that i have this.
Reviews.Title: love this

Reviews.Author: Heather Davis
Reviews.Content: This has been one of my best purchases yet! Its been a little tough learning the Android OS vs. Apple OS but it's all good. I would highly recommend it right up there with the iPad:)
Reviews.Title: Everything i needed!

Reviews.Author: V Betz
Reviews.Content: what could you do not love this .  it does everything and more... the best thing to take with you to dr. or waiting in  a car or anywhere. you can play games megs, music. wow so much more,, you can get on line get email.. just a wonderful as a ipad (maybe even better)...lovvve it.
Reviews.Title: wow

Reviews.Author: patti
Reviews.Content: I wanted to get a new tablet as I had the 1st generation ipad. Did not want to spend $500 so I checked out the competition.I am very pleased with the screen quality and how fast this Kindle is, but the layout of my most used pages: hotmail & Facebook are hard to get used to.  Also, being a smaller screen, it's harder for me to read some print.  All in all, a good deal and beautiful picture.
Reviews.Title: replacing ipad 1

Reviews.Author: Micah Boyd
Reviews.Content: Excellent product with no hassle exchange for out of warranty, less expensive kindle.  Why buy new?  Comparable. To my son's IPad Air.
Reviews.Title: Why buy new?

Reviews.Author: Anita Richards
Reviews.Content: this worked very well for 5 months...then froze up, replacement came and it was faulty. Third replacement came and so far so good,  I must say all Kindle Support  folks were wonderful, helpful and right there for me Great supportive service and it was IMMEDIATE !  My rating will probably become higher once I pass that 6 month marker.
Reviews.Title: 8.9" Kindle Fire review

Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: Battery is an issue. Rarely charges to 100% even when it's plugged in overnight. Often reaches 98% but not 100%.
Reviews.Title: Tough to charge

Reviews.Author: sheila cooley
Reviews.Content: I give the product a rating of two because it does not hold charge very long and it takes forever to charge. I believe the charging system on mine is not working properly because people I know has the same one and they said they don't have that problem. Only one person I know said they had the same problem and was sent a different charger and it fixed their problem . I cant see putting more money into the product unless I know for sure it will correct the problem because I have invested quite a bit already and have only had it a few months.
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD review

Reviews.Author: Nyla Ross
Reviews.Content: My daughter uses this device and says that has trouble downloading and using downloaded apps. And don't like that she cannot use screen saver on hers.
Reviews.Title: Should have bought the one without the discount!

Reviews.Author: Therese Romano
Reviews.Content: My husband was going to spend money on an ipad for me but I wasn't very excited about that, since I never learned to use my itouch correctly.  My sister-in-law has the kindle with a smaller screen and she loves hers so I suggested that.  I love it.  I can't leave it alone. I can pick up emails, shop on line, read, and play games.  I recently ordered 2 books.  Now I can't put it down because of the book I'm reading. Buy it, you'll love it.
Reviews.Title: Amazing

Reviews.Author: Coraly
Reviews.Content: I previously purchased the Kindle Fire HD 7" 16gb for $159 and I'm so glad I exchanged it for the Kindle Fire HD 8.9" 16gb 2012 for $229 because although it's a year behind its just as good as the 7" 2013, And in my opinion, Even Better! The reasons I say this is first off the 8.9" has a front facing camera for Skype and if you download a certain editing app you can access the camera itself and the newer 2013 doesn't even have a camera. The screen is actually a huge difference from the 7" if you compare them side to side, the 8.9 is such a bigger screen. My sister even wants to return hers 7", She said, ("It Looks like a toy next to yours"). lol :) Also the screen resolution for the 7"  is only 1280x800 vs the 2012 8.9" is 1920x1200, so the screen is so much more beautiful and clear than the "newer improved" version. And, the processors are both Dual Core Processor 1.5 Ghz. So overall in my opinion between the two this one beats it by leaps and bounds.
Reviews.Title: Switched from Kindle Fire HD 7 2013 to HD 8.9 2012 And Glad I did!

Reviews.Author: Gmadonna
Reviews.Content: I didn't realize how messed up my original Kindle Fire was until I got the replacement. Thank you, thank you, thank you for allowing me to return the original Kindle and get one that really works. I love the Kindle Fire. One of my better investments.
Reviews.Title: AWESOME

Reviews.Author: Jackielk
Reviews.Content: The wifi kept getting tossed off.  also I was told that you could read it in the sun but you  can not
Reviews.Title: Hard ot read in teh sun adn Wifi not strong

Reviews.Author: Brady Brown
Reviews.Content: I'm sure the new upgrades are fabulous, but a year age, there wasn't enough difference to recommend the first Fire over the original.  We found the lighter 7" to be better for our young daughter and for reading in bed than this larger one was to hold.  Also, the kid's Freetime didn't have the content we were looking for as a main selling point.  Too many attempts to sell us in-app purchases and "outside the sandbox" app upgrades, and too many commercialized brand name characters. If this changes, I'd gladly renew my subscription!
Reviews.Title: Last year's model 8.9

Reviews.Author: Ferd J Ferrell
Reviews.Content: I have other computers, tablets, and smart phones and I had not given a Kindle much thought, because I continue to like real books. I ordered the Kindle for my wife, but as all husbands may or may not do, I had to explore. Long story short...I got a great deal on the Kindle by getting an Amazon credit card and they had a sale going on.What a great purchase !!!! The Kindle ties in so well with Amazon. Reading on the Kindle has many advantages that I was unaware of, such as it reading to you...The picture is clear, the sound fantastic and the use is easy to learn.I would recommend this tablet to anyone and also getting an Amazon credit card to go with it makes it even better...
Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9"

Reviews.Author: Dawn Du Plooy
Reviews.Content: The device keeps turning itself off even though it is fully charged. Then u r unable to turn it back on with the power button. Was only used 2 1/2 weeks before this problem started.
Reviews.Title: In shock

Reviews.Author: arlene Avallone
Reviews.Content: I am quite happy with my Kindle ,confused, not sure how to delete programs that I have usedAlso when I received my Kindle there was not charger; I am using my phone charger
Reviews.Title: Did not receive a charged with my Kindle

Reviews.Author: Jj
Reviews.Content: In so many ways, I am pleased with the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 tablet.  Both picture and sound quality are amazingly good and provides an enjoyable experience.  I love using the Kindle as a book and I can travel with it, taking with me, dozen of Kindle books.  That is AWESOME!  This is my second one, since after almost a year, my first Kindle (same model) began to freeze quite often.  Several times a day, It would just stop working.  After I tried all the fixes available on the Amazon website, I contacted their technical support.  After a few tries to fix it, the technician volunteered to send me another at no charge and gave me a label to send back the old unit free of charge.  I LOVE AMAZON!  When I got the new one, it was already loaded with all my old contents and I used it without trouble, up until the last few day.  It now freezes, but only occasionally.  That's just enough to make me uneasy about this units future.However, I have two other concerns.  First and foremost, it is not capable of playing Flash Player videos, which constitutes about half of the videos available on line.  This is very frustrating because there are lots that I want to play, but the Kindle is not compatible and Amazon told me that there are no plans to change that.  Since they are otherwise, so accommodating to the consumer's needs, that seems odd.  Secondly,I am a subscriber to Acorn TV.  While it works on my apple computer, it does not work on my Kindle.  I am not really sure if this issue is one and the same (to not being able to play Flash Player), but if this flaw is addressed, I will gladly give the Kindle 5 STARS.
Reviews.Title: I LOVE IT!  However.....

Reviews.Author: Erin Taylor
Reviews.Content: I didn't purchase it on Amazon, I was but I went to a local staples store to demo it first anyway, but I purchased it there.
